</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>Like fellow multimedia phenomenon <em>The Princess Bride</em>, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Neverending-Story-Michael-Ende-ebook/dp/B07FLP3XNP?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07FLP3XNP" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Neverending Story</em></strong></a> uses a framework narrative to reflect on the power of, well, stories. The title refers to a book within the book: an antique volume unearthed by a boy called Bastian, an outsider at odds with schoolyard bullies and a distant father. As he reads ‚Äî with us peering over his shoulder ‚Äî Bastian is <em>literally</em> pulled into the story of Fantastica, a magical realm ruled by an immortal Childlike Empress. But the empress is dying, and without her power, Fantastica and all its people will disappear. It‚Äôs up to reader-turned-protagonist Bastian to save her.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Little-Big-John-Crowley-ebook/dp/B005DB7O0U?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B005DB7O0U" data-book-info="{'title':'Little, Big','slug':'little-big-john-crowley-c14a9203-8c53-4ccb-ac32-03bd0af298e6','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B005DB7O0U?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Ce3fS25dL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Ce3fS25dL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['John Crowley']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Little-Big-John-Crowley-ebook/dp/B005DB7O0U?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B005DB7O0U" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Little, Big</em></strong></a> is the perfect fantasy novel for people who don‚Äôt like fantasy. It reads like a prestigious generational saga, the kind of thing you‚Äôd find in English dissertations and on Booker Prize shortlists ‚Äî just with a few fairies thrown into the mix. No wonder literary critic Harold Bloom, notorious for thumbing his nose at the likes of <em>Harry Potter</em>, praised it as a ‚Äúneglected masterpiece.‚Äù At its center is the Drinkwater family, whose architect patriarch built their sprawling family estate in the hazy borderlands between the Faerie world and New York ‚Äî which invites a great deal of complexity into their lives.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Dark-Tower-I-Gunslinger-ebook/dp/B018ER7JRC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B018ER7JRC" data-book-info="{'title':'The Dark Tower I: The Gunslinger','slug':'the-dark-tower-i-the-gunslinger-stephen-king','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B018ER7JRC?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51HDlI3s9eL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51HDlI3s9eL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Stephen King']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51HDlI3s9eL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="299"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51HDlI3s9eL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Dark Tower I: The Gunslinger" height="181"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>20. <em>The Gunslinger</em> by Stephen King (1982) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Stephen King is best known for <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/best-stephen-king-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>infiltrating our nightmares</strong></a> with stalkers and murderous clowns. But <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Dark-Tower-I-Gunslinger-ebook/dp/B018ER7JRC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B018ER7JRC" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Gunslinger</em></strong></a> proves he‚Äôs got a gift for fantasy too ‚Äî just don‚Äôt expect it to be light and fluffy! This novel pulls from a broad palette of influences, from cowboy westerns to the poetry of Robert Browning. The hero, Roland of Gilead, wields his gun in pursuit of a shadowy Man in Black who's as dangerous as he is mysterious, with the power to spawn demons and raise the dead. Luckily or not, Roland's not alone in his pursuit; he finds a traveling companion in Jake Chambers, a schoolboy from our world.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Color-Magic-Novel-Discworld-ebook/dp/B000W9399S?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000W9399S" data-book-info="{'title':'The Color of Magic: A Novel of Discworld','slug':'the-color-of-magic-a-novel-of-discworld-terry-pratchett','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000W9399S?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Vh3wGCBVL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Vh3wGCBVL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Terry Pratchett']}" contenteditable="false">

      </g>

  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>Beloved fantasy writer Terry Pratchett made his name on tales from Discworld: a flat, circular planet, carried on the backs of four elephants balanced on a turtle. The 41-book series is a world unto its own ‚Äî and it all began with <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Color-Magic-Novel-Discworld-ebook/dp/B000W9399S?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000W9399S" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Color of Magic</em></strong></a>. Pratchett conceived the book as an antidote to the dark lord-y, paint-by-numbers fantasy that saturated the market at the time. The result is playful-yet-thoughtful story about an incompetent wizard and a ignorant tourist, whose adventure reads like a hilarious, sparkling travelogue.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Mists-Avalon-Marion-Zimmer-Bradley-ebook/dp/B000FC1JCQ?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FC1JCQ" data-book-info="{'title':'The Mists of Avalon: A Novel','slug':'the-mists-of-avalon-a-novel-marion-zimmer-bradley','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000FC1JCQ?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41II-qq8gpL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41II-qq8gpL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Marion Zimmer Bradley']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>The most influential reimagining of the Arthurian legend since <em>The Sword and the Stone</em>, this sharply observed novel turns a feminist gaze on age-old tales. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Mists-Avalon-Marion-Zimmer-Bradley-ebook/dp/B000FC1JCQ?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FC1JCQ" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Mists of Avalon</em></strong></a> centers on Arthur‚Äôs sorcerous half-sister Morgaine ‚Äî better known as Morgan le Fay. A pagan priestess of Avalon blessed with clairvoyance, she‚Äôs troubled by the encroachment of Christian missionaries into the land she loves. Her sister-in-law Gwenhwyfar, meanwhile, emerges as her opposite: a devout and increasingly fanatical Christian. The ideological clash between them represents a far greater conflict, which the book unflinchingly depicts with all the dark tragedy of the original legend.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Bridge-Birds-Ancient-Chronicles-Master/dp/0345321383?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0345321383" data-book-info="{'title':'Bridge of Birds','slug':'bridge-of-birds-barry-hughart','synopsis':'When the children of his village were struck with a mysterious illness, Number Ten Ox sought a wiseman to save them. He found master Li Kao, a scholar with a slight flaw in his character. Together, they set out to find the Great Root of Power, the only possible cure.<br /><br />The quest led them to a host of truly memorable characters, multiple wonders, incredible adventures‚Äîand strange coincidences, which were really not coincidences at all. And it involved them in an ancient crime that still perturbed the serenity of Heaven. Simply and charmingly told, this is a wry tale, a sly tale, and a story of wisdom delightfully askew. Once read, its marvels and beauty will not easily fade from the mind.<br /><br />The author claims that this is a novel of an ancient China that never was. But, oh‚Ä¶it should have been!','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0345321383?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1327940289l/15177._SY160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Barry Hughart']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>
In an era when ‚Äúfantasy‚Äù was synonymous with ‚Äúfake medieval Europe,‚Äù <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Bridge-Birds-Ancient-Chronicles-Master/dp/0345321383?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0345321383" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Bridge of Birds</em></strong></a> gave us something wonderfully original: a novel set ‚Äî as its subtitle explains ‚Äî in ‚Äúan ancient China that never was.‚Äù We see this reimagining through the eyes of Number Ten Ox, a young man those village is ravaged by a mysterious plague that destroys silkworms and renders its children unconscious. He finds aid in Master Li Kao, a scholar with a drinking problem ‚Äî and an encyclopedic knowledge of poisons. Together, Number Ten Ox and Master Li set off in search for a cure... only to be drawn into the heady world of imperial politics.</p><p>
</p><p><br></p><p>
</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Mythago-Wood-Cycle-Robert-Holdstock/dp/0765307294?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765307294" data-book-info="{'title':'Mythago Wood','slug':'mythago-wood-robert-holdstock','synopsis':'The mystery of Ryhope Wood, Britain's last fragment of primeval forest, consumed George Huxley's entire, and long, life. Now, after his death, his sons have taken up his work. But what they discover is beyond what they could have expected. For the Wood is a realm where myths gain flesh and blood, tapping primal fears and desires subdued through the millennia. A realm where love and beauty haunt your dreams -- and may drive you insane. <br /><br />Mythago Wood won the World Fantasy Award on its first publication in 1984, and secured Robert Holdstock's reputation as one of the major fantasy writers of our time. Now it returns to print in America for the first time in nearly a decade.','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0765307294?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1308639607l/126192.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Robert Holdstock']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="false">

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div></div>
<div class="blurb"><p>Celebrated for its dazzling prose, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Mythago-Wood-Cycle-Robert-Holdstock/dp/0765307294?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765307294" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Mythago Wood</em></strong></a> is as densely enchanting as the English forest at its center: the ancient, otherworldly Ryhope Wood. Make your way between the old-growth trees and you'll discover its inhabitants ‚Äî myth-images, or mythagos, who have come out of ancestral memory and the story-seeped subconscious of the human mind. These might be monsters, centaurs, or several different versions of King Arthur. We explore Ryhope Wood with the Huxley brothers: World War II veteran Stephen regards the forest‚Äôs mysteries with measured skepticism, even as his brother Christian starts to lose himself within it.¬†¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Howls-Moving-Castle-Book-ebook/dp/B008LV8TSU?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B008LV8TSU" data-book-info="{'title':'Howl's Moving Castle (Howl's Castle Book 1)','slug':'howl-s-moving-castle-howl-s-castle-book-1-diana-wynne-jones','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B008LV8TSU?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51ISwYcrAxL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51ISwYcrAxL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Diana Wynne Jones']}" contenteditable="false">

</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>Gorgeously brought to life by the Studio Ghibli anime of the same name, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Howls-Moving-Castle-Book-ebook/dp/B008LV8TSU?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B008LV8TSU" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Howl‚Äôs Moving Castle</em></strong></a> combines whimsy and poignancy in the tradition of the <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/best-childrens-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>best children‚Äôs fiction</strong></a> ‚Äî and doesn't skimp on the allusions, moving breezily from Shakespeare to Lewis Carroll. The story begins with 18-year-old Sophie Hatter, who seems condemned to a lifetime of drudgery at the family hat shop. But when she‚Äôs aged several decades by a witch‚Äôs curse, a suddenly geriatric Sophie finds her way to a moving castle ruled by the eccentric wizard Howl, whose fire-demon servant holds the key to restoring her youth.¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Good-Omens-Accurate-Prophecies-Nutter/dp/0060853972?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0060853972" data-book-info="{'title':'Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch','slug':'good-omens-the-nice-and-accurate-prophecies-of-agnes-nutter-witch-terry-pratchett','synopsis':'‚ÄòArmageddon only happens once, you know. They don‚Äôt let you go around again until you get it right.‚Äô<br /><br />People have been predicting the end of the world almost from its very beginning, so it‚Äôs only natural to be sceptical when a new date is set for Judgement Day. But what if, for once, the predictions are right, and the apocalypse really is due to arrive next Saturday, just after tea?<br /><br />You could spend the time left drowning your sorrows, giving away all your possessions in preparation for the rapture, or laughing it off as (hopefully) just another hoax. Or you could just try to do something about it.<br /><br />It‚Äôs a predicament that Aziraphale, a somewhat fussy angel, and Crowley, a fast-living demon now finds themselves in. They‚Äôve been living amongst Earth‚Äôs mortals since The Beginning and, truth be told, have grown rather fond of the lifestyle and, in all honesty, are not actually looking forward to the coming Apocalypse.<br /><br />And then there‚Äôs the small matter that someone appears to have misplaced the Antichrist‚Ä¶','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0060853972?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1450459140l/12070.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Terry Pratchett']}" contenteditable="false">

  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>The end of the world has never been so funny. Equal parts biting and heartwarming, this charmingly English take on the Apocalypse combines the talents of golden-age Terry Pratchett and a young Neil Gaiman just discovering his novelistic voice. Take this dream team, add 50% more laughter than you think is possible, and you‚Äôll have <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Good-Omens-Accurate-Prophecies-Nutter/dp/0060853972?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0060853972" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Good Omens</em></strong></a>. The book‚Äôs tween Anti-Christ, Adam, is refreshingly human and irresistibly likable. But its true stars are the fussy angel Aziraphale and sauntering demon Crowley, who steal the show with their unlikely bond ‚Äî and their rogue efforts to put a pin in Armageddon.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Famished-Road-Novel-Ben-Okri-ebook/dp/B01KYUOAZG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01KYUOAZG" data-book-info="{'title':'The Famished Road: A Novel (The Famished Road Trilogy Book 1)','slug':'the-famished-road-a-novel-the-famished-road-trilogy-book-1-ben-okri','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01KYUOAZG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/514t7+BlU+L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/514t7+BlU+L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Ben Okri']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb">
<p>Booker Prize winner <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Famished-Road-Novel-Ben-Okri-ebook/dp/B01KYUOAZG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01KYUOAZG" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Famished Road</em></strong></a> makes an eloquent case for the place of magical creatures in the literary big leagues ‚Äî and, in 1991, brought fantasy out of its traditional Anglo-American silo. Author Ben Okri moves fluidly between genres and influences: combining Yoruba oral traditions and Shakespearean allusions, mixing <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/magical-realism" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>magical realism</strong></a> with Enlightenment philosophy. His very protagonist, Azaro, is a creature of the hybrid and the in-between: an <em>abiku</em>, or child spirit, he dwells between the realms of the living and the dead. But Okri manages to ground this unorthodox story with spare, elegant prose and devastating pathos.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Was-novel-Geoff-Ryman-ebook/dp/B00BAZV4FY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00BAZV4FY" data-book-info="{'title':'Was: a novel','slug':'was-a-novel-geoff-ryman','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BAZV4FY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41lOZ-uPxUL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41lOZ-uPxUL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Geoff Ryman']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BAZV4FY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BAZV4FY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="was-a-novel-geoff-ryman" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This wildly inventive novel snagged a nomination for the World Fantasy Prize, but it‚Äôs about as far from sword and sorcery as you can get. A gritty remix of <em>The Wonderful Wizard of Oz</em>, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Was-novel-Geoff-Ryman-ebook/dp/B00BAZV4FY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00BAZV4FY" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Was</em></strong></a> uses L. Frank Baum‚Äôs sunny fable to examine the mundane tragedies of modern life, from child abuse to HIV. The main character of this tale is an orphan named Dorothy Gael, whose Uncle Henry abuses her with Aunty Em‚Äôs tacit consent. Her story runs alongside another one equally tragic ‚Äî that of a gay actor weakened by AIDS. Close to dying, he rallies for a final pilgrimage to Kansas, drawn by memories of his childhood fascination with Oz.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Interview-Vampire-Chronicles-Book-ebook/dp/B004AM5R20?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B004AM5R20" data-book-info="{'title':'Interview with the Vampire (The Vampire Chronicles, Book 1)','slug':'interview-with-the-vampire-the-vampire-chronicles-book-1-anne-rice','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B004AM5R20?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51U5LSYpe6L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51U5LSYpe6L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Anne Rice']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B004AM5R20?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B004AM5R20?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="interview-with-the-vampire-the-vampire-chronicles-book-1-anne-rice" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Haunting, sexy, and grim, Anne Rice‚Äôs gothic novel paved the way for Twilightmania ‚Äî just don‚Äôt expect her vampires to sparkle. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Interview-Vampire-Chronicles-Book-ebook/dp/B004AM5R20?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B004AM5R20" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Interview with the Vampire</em></strong></a> centers on 200-year-old, world-weary Louis, who finds himself telling his life story to a cub reporter. As we listen in on their interview, we meet the colorful characters who shaped Louis‚Äô long afterlife: his cruelly charismatic lover Lestat ‚Äî the vampire who turned him ‚Äî and their tragic ‚Äúdaughter‚Äù Claudia, whose eternally childish form can‚Äôt contain her sharp wit and grown-up rage.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Towing-Jehovah-Harvest-James-Morrow-ebook/dp/B00IWTRB3A?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00IWTRB3A" data-book-info="{'title':'Towing Jehovah (Harvest Book)','slug':'towing-jehovah-harvest-book-james-morrow','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00IWTRB3A?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51RAT9SaZXL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51RAT9SaZXL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['James Morrow']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51RAT9SaZXL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="307"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51RAT9SaZXL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="Towing Jehovah (Harvest Book)" height="186"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>30. <em>Towing Jehovah</em> by James Morrow (1994) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00IWTRB3A?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00IWTRB3A?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="towing-jehovah-harvest-book-james-morrow" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This oddball religious satire spins the famous Nietzsche quote into a fantastic story: God is dead, and now there‚Äôs another corpse in the Atlantic, looking like any old white guy ‚Äî except two miles long. As a result, oil tanker captain Anthony Van Horne finds himself with an unexpected new gig, courtesy of the archangel Raphael. The heavenly hosts expect him to, well, <em>tow Jehovah</em>: transport His corpse to the Arctic to be embalmed by its icy waters. Morrow‚Äôs effervescent cleverness has drawn endless comparisons to <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/kurt-vonnegut-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>Kurt Vonnegut</strong></a>, but <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Towing-Jehovah-Harvest-James-Morrow-ebook/dp/B00IWTRB3A?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00IWTRB3A" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Towing Jehovah</em></strong></a>‚Äôs theological snark evokes <em>Good Omens</em>, too.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Assassins-Apprentice-Farseer-Trilogy-Book-ebook/dp/B000FBFMG6?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FBFMG6" data-book-info="{'title':'Assassin's Apprentice (The Farseer Trilogy, Book 1)','slug':'assassin-s-apprentice-the-farseer-trilogy-book-1-robin-hobb','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000FBFMG6?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51BLMpvx6BL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51BLMpvx6BL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Robin Hobb','Michael Whelan','John Howe']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>A stunning example of high, epic fantasy played straight, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Assassins-Apprentice-Farseer-Trilogy-Book-ebook/dp/B000FBFMG6?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FBFMG6" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Assassin‚Äôs Apprentice</em></strong></a> introduces us to the bravest bastard this side of Jon Snow. The illegitimate son of a prince named Chivalry, the boy called Fitz grows up a loner. If he wants company, he prefers to draw on the Wit ‚Äî his telepathic link to animals ‚Äî instead of talking to another human. But when his powerful relations finally summon him to court, Fitz is forced to change his wild ways ‚Äî and soon begins training as an assassin and kingsman to the new ruler, Shrewd (another symbolic name).</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/His-Dark-Materials-Golden-Compass-ebook/dp/B000FC1ICM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FC1ICM" data-book-info="{'title':'His Dark Materials: The Golden Compass (Book 1)','slug':'his-dark-materials-the-golden-compass-book-1-philip-pullman','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000FC1ICM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516YLKoyukL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516YLKoyukL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Philip Pullman']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

<div class="blurb">
<p>This stunning YA fantasy opens the <em>His Dark Materials</em> trilogy, which can only be described as the anti-Narnia: a literary monument to secular humanism. This first installment centers on Lyra Belacqua, an orphan raised by a committee of graybeards at Oxford. <a href="https://blog.reedsy.com/worldbuilding-guide/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>Her fantastical world is crafted</strong></a> by Pullman with all the deft-fingered care of a Renaissance painter, laying on the details stroke by stroke. Perhaps most excitingly, here there be daemons: externalized souls that tail each person in animal form. Lyra‚Äôs daemon, Pantalaimon, is one of the book‚Äôs most lovable (and important) characters ‚Äî and after reading <a href="https://www.amazon.com/His-Dark-Materials-Golden-Compass-ebook/dp/B000FC1ICM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FC1ICM" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Golden Compass</em></strong></a><em>,</em> you‚Äôll definitely want your own.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Game-Thrones-Song-Fire-Book-ebook/dp/B000QCS8TW?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000QCS8TW" data-book-info="{'title':'A Game of Thrones (A Song of Ice and Fire, Book 1)','slug':'a-game-of-thrones-a-song-of-ice-and-fire-book-1-george-r-r-martin-d6c0f63f-2a6f-4400-8cbf-6dba78ef8fa8','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000QCS8TW?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51D+-f5UcDL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51D+-f5UcDL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['George R. Martin (1996) </strong></h2></div>

</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>While we wait for G.R.R. Martin to finish up his long-running series‚Äô sixth installment, it‚Äôs worth revisiting the book that made his name ‚Äî and gave<em> its </em>name to the show that brought TV fantasy into the mainstream. If <em>His Dark Materials</em> is the anti-Narnia, then <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Game-Thrones-Song-Fire-Book-ebook/dp/B000QCS8TW?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000QCS8TW" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>A Game of Thrones</em></strong></a> and its sequels are the anti-LOTR. In a sharp-toothed reaction to Tolkien‚Äôs idealism, Martin gives us a quasi-medieval setting as rich in magic as Middle-earth, though it runs on cynical realpolitik instead of quiet courage. <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/grimdark-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>In this grimdark world</strong></a>, winter is coming, debts must be paid, and noble characters can die ugly, senseless deaths at any time.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Harry-Potter-Sorcerers-Stone-Rowling-ebook/dp/B0192CTMYG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B0192CTMYG" data-book-info="{'title':'Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone','slug':'harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone-j-k-rowling-fa9241b6-e792-4d7c-b12f-f39585c96854','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0192CTMYG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41lnLrvBnML.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41lnLrvBnML._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['J.K. Rowling (1997) </strong></h2></div>

  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>If you need a summary of <em>this </em>book, you‚Äôve been living under a rock for the past few decades. Love them or hate them, <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/harry-potter-books-in-order" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>the <em>Harry Potter</em> series</strong></a> has shaped millennials more than any other media phenomena, creating a generation of bookworms inclined to question authority. The Boy Who Lived is now approaching middle-age ‚Äî canonically born in 1980, he's just about 40 now. But as the book that kickstarted his literary career, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Harry-Potter-Sorcerers-Stone-Rowling-ebook/dp/B0192CTMYG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B0192CTMYG" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</em></strong></a> remains as influential as ever, with Hogwarts houses being as legitimate a source of identity as zodiac signs.¬†¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>

<div class="blurb">
<p><em>A Game of Thrones </em>might be the more famous book today, but <a href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/1433254921?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Moon and the Sun</em></strong></a> narrowly beat it out to win the prestigious Nebula Award for Best Novel in 1998! An intricate historical romance made magical through the addition of mermaids and immortality quests, <em>The Moon and the Sun</em> takes place in the palace of the Sun King, who ruled over late 17th-century France. We encounter his dazzling world through the eyes of Marie-Jos√®phe de la Croix, a lady-in-waiting who is the only person at court able to see Versailles‚Äô new mermaid resident as a person instead of a monster (with delicious shades of <em>The Shape of Water</em>).</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>

<div class="blurb"><p>China Mi√©ville has defined his own work as ‚Äúa breathless and genre-slippery macabre fiction‚Äù ‚Äî and with its heady mixture of <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/steampunk-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>Victorian tech</strong></a>, black magic, and organized crime, this book is par for the course. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Perdido-Street-Station-Bas-Lag-Mi%C3%A9ville/dp/0345443020?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0345443020" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Perdido Street Station</em></strong></a> takes place in the steampunk city of New Crobuzon, where humans rub shoulders with other strange and intelligent species. But this peaceful coexistence is jeopardized when a hallucinogenic experiment unleashes the slakemoth: a mind-eating monster with paralytic in its wings. As they attempt to save the city, protagonist Isaac and his friends soon find themselves pulled into the seedy underbelly of New Crobuzon politics, discovering more than they ever wanted to know about their bizarre home.</p></div>

<div class="blurb">
<p>A decade after <em>Good Omens</em>, Neil Gaiman returned to the world of religious fantasy with this magnificent solo venture. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/American-Gods-Novel-Neil-Gaiman/dp/0062572237?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0062572237" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>American Gods</em></strong></a> blends old legends with a <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/urban-fantasy-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>modern noir sensibility</strong></a> ‚Äî it‚Äôs peopled with deities and convicts, and the distinctions between them aren‚Äôt always clear. At its center is the improbably named Shadow Moon, a new widower who drifts into the employ of a con-man named Mr. Wednesday. They go on a good, old-fashioned American road-trip ‚Äî but Shadow soon discovers that their cross-country trek isn‚Äôt all that it appears to be</p>

<div class="blurb"><p>Every once in a while, you encounter a voice of such talent and originality it stands out like a signal fire against the night. In the world of fantasy, Susannah Clarke is that voice. Her magnum opus, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Jonathan-Strange-Norrell-Susanna-Clarke-ebook/dp/B003RRXXMA?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B003RRXXMA" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Jonathan Strange & Mr Norrell</em></strong></a><em>,</em> is an alternate history of England during the Napoleonic Wars, combining Gothic fiction with comedy of manners to interrogate romantic myths of the English past.¬†After a full decade in the making, it catapulted straight from Bloomsbury‚Äôs press to <em>The New York Times</em> bestseller list. The rest is history ‚Äî or, should we say, alternate history.</p></div>

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This witty, sci-fi/fantasy take on the afterlife has shades of both <em>The Good Place</em> and <em>Black Mirror </em>‚Äî and fittingly enough, reflects consistently on the notion of endings. Before his suicide, protagonist Ben Mendelssohn was a professional ender: a ghostwriter for authors unable to <a href="https://blog.reedsy.com/how-to-end-a-story/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>finish their own stories</strong></a>. And after putting a bullet in his own head, Ben emerges in the Other World: a strangely sterile afterlife where the shades of the dead can customize their own microclimates. Clearly, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/World-End-Ofir-Touch%C3%A9-Gafla-ebook/dp/B00CK5ATUE?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00CK5ATUE" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The World of the End</em></strong></a> was an incredibly precocious ‚Äî maybe even prophetic ‚Äî work, anticipating pop cultural themes a decade ahead of time.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Name-Wind-Kingkiller-Chronicle-Book-ebook/dp/B0010SKUYM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B0010SKUYM" data-book-info="{'title':'The Name of the Wind (The Kingkiller Chronicle Book 1)','slug':'the-name-of-the-wind-the-kingkiller-chronicle-book-1-patrick-rothfuss','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0010SKUYM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51MUF7bj-lL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51MUF7bj-lL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Patrick Rothfuss']}" contenteditable="false">

</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Name-Wind-Kingkiller-Chronicle-Book-ebook/dp/B0010SKUYM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B0010SKUYM" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Name of the Wind</em></strong></a> boasts another complicated framework narrative that, in this case, turns the entire work into a meditation on the importance of storytelling. It‚Äôs told as a fictional autobiography whose subject ‚Äî and narrator ‚Äî is the legendary culture-hero Kvothe, living incognito at the novel‚Äôs beginning as a humble innkeeper. But his cover‚Äôs blown following the appearance, in the flesh, of a demon long relegated to the realm of myths. Long story short ‚Äî or if you read the whole thing, long story long ‚Äî Kvothe ends up recounting the submerged stories of his past, from his magical education to his myriad heartbreaks.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Magicians-Novel-Lev-Grossman-ebook/dp/B002AU7MJU?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002AU7MJU" data-book-info="{'title':'The Magicians: A Novel','slug':'the-magicians-a-novel-lev-grossman-fa928888-b1ad-454b-8408-b0e06abed8b9','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002AU7MJU?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/511xS-QCd2L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/511xS-QCd2L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Lev Grossman']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This high fantasy novel (in the guise of <em>New Yorker</em>-friendly lit fic) follows a high school senior named Quentin, who finds his way into magic college en route to his Princeton interview. But there are no sun-drenched Quidditch matches at Brakebills: instead, the curriculum turns on classical philology and the memorization of magical hand positions. Indeed, between this and its frank treatment of sexuality and mental health, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Magicians-Novel-Lev-Grossman-ebook/dp/B002AU7MJU?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002AU7MJU" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Magicians</em></strong></a> has often been touted as a ‚ÄúHarry Potter for grownups.‚Äù And if you‚Äôre more Ravenclaw than Gryffindor, you might find yourself daydreaming about Brakebills instead of Hogwarts ‚Äî at least until Grossman deconstructs the trope of the magical boarding school with devastating acuity.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Under-Heaven-Guy-Gavriel-Kay-ebook/dp/B003NX7NEM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B003NX7NEM" data-book-info="{'title':'Under Heaven','slug':'under-heaven-guy-gavriel-kay-a6a4a764-377e-47cd-a396-59999ae5b0ec','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003NX7NEM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUv610dYL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUv610dYL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Guy Gavriel Kay']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Guy Gavriel Kay is a sorcerer in the realm of alternate history ‚Äî his usual M.O. entails magic-drenched versions of ancient Constantinople or Renaissance Italy. In <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Under-Heaven-Guy-Gavriel-Kay-ebook/dp/B003NX7NEM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B003NX7NEM" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Under Heaven</em></strong></a>, Kay turns his talents to medieval China, with a version of the country called Kitai having recently achieved a hard-fought peace. Shen Tai, the second son of a legendary general, takes advantage of the ceasefire to bury the long-abandoned dead: both his own Kitai countrymen and their Taguran enemies, whose ghosts still haunt the site of their fatal defeats. In response, the Taguran empress gifts him a herd of 250 prized horses ‚Äî making him an immediate target in the next round of Kitai political intrigues.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Hundred-Thousand-Kingdoms-Inheritance-Trilogy-ebook/dp/B002ZDJZO2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002ZDJZO2" data-book-info="{'title':'The Hundred Thousand Kingdoms (The Inheritance Trilogy Book 1)','slug':'the-hundred-thousand-kingdoms-the-inheritance-trilogy-book-1-n-k-jemisin','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002ZDJZO2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Y9jDo536L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Y9jDo536L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['N.K. Jemisin']}" contenteditable="false">

Jemisin (2010) </strong></h2></div>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>These days, N.K. Jemisin is a bona fide thought leader who writes full-time, but <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Hundred-Thousand-Kingdoms-Inheritance-Trilogy-ebook/dp/B002ZDJZO2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002ZDJZO2" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Hundred Thousand Kingdoms</em></strong></a> was the match that sparked her incandescent career. It opens as such: following her mother's death, a biracial woman named Yeine Darr is summoned to the floating city of Sky and told she‚Äôs descended from Sky‚Äôs ruling house. But on her father‚Äôs side, she belongs to the Darre ‚Äî a people considered barbarians by her mother's kin. This revelation pulls her into a struggle of succession and identity, all of which Yeine must navigate as she tries to solve her mother's mysterious murder.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Who-Fears-Death-Nnedi-Okorafor/dp/0756407281?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0756407281" data-book-info="{'title':'Who Fears Death','slug':'who-fears-death-nnedi-okorafor-74b87f46-eef7-48fc-9e00-f2af006a2330','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0756407281?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41w2vCvbgRL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41w2vCvbgRL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Nnedi Okorafor']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41w2vCvbgRL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="297"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41w2vCvbgRL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="Who Fears Death" height="180"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>45. <em>Who Fears Death</em> by Nnedi Okorafor (2010) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/0756407281?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/0756407281?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="who-fears-death-nnedi-okorafor-74b87f46-eef7-48fc-9e00-f2af006a2330" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This searing novel is rooted in the real-life tragedy of weaponized rape in the Darfur conflict, which Okorafor read about just as she was beginning work on it. The narrator of <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Who-Fears-Death-Nnedi-Okorafor/dp/0756407281?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0756407281" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Who Fears Death</em></strong></a>, Onyesonwu, is the product of similar racial violence; she's born to an Okeke woman, raped by the light-skinned Nuru sorcerer responsible for the massacre of her village. Named for a question ‚Äî ‚ÄúWho Fears Death?‚Äù‚Äî¬†she develops magical gifts to rival her wicked father‚Äôs. And after honing her abilities under the tutelage of a powerful shaman, Onyesonwu takes on a quest: to end the genocide of her mother‚Äôs people forever.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Among-Others-Hugo-Award-Winner/dp/0765331721?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765331721" data-book-info="{'title':'Among Others','slug':'among-others-jo-walton-7b178b59-cd7d-4088-9ed5-6828ee439686','synopsis':'Startling, unusual, and irresistibly readable, <i>Among Others </i>is at once the compelling story of a young woman struggling to escape a troubled childhood, a brilliant diary of first encounters with the great novels of modern fantasy and science fiction, and a spellbinding tale of escape from ancient enchantment.<br /><br />As a child growing up in Wales, Morwenna played among the spirits who made their homes in industrial ruins. But her mind found freedom in the science fiction novels that were her closest companions. When her half-mad mother tried to bend the spirits to dark ends, Mori was forced to confront her in a magical battle that left her crippled--and her twin sister dead.<br /><br />Fleeing to a father whom she barely knew, Mori was sent to boarding school in England--a place all but devoid of true magic. There, she tempted fate by doing magic herself, in an attempt to find a circle of like-minded friends. But her magic also drew the attention of her mother, bringing about a reckoning that could no longer be put off...<br /><br />Combining elements of autobiography with flights of imagination, this is a stunning new novel by an author whose genius has already been hailed by dozens of her peers.','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0765331721?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1327010385l/11669085.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Jo Walton']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>
This inventive, award-winning book portrays the coming-of-age of Morwenna Phelps, a teenager who recently lost both her twin and the use of her legs thanks to a magical accident. Her story is refracted in a charmingly meta fashion, and has a comforting familiarity of form, as we see everything through Mori‚Äôs journal entries ‚Äî where she vents about math classes, bra shopping, and first love along with the difficulties of spell-casting. If you‚Äôre into quirky, genre-bending works, you‚Äôll definitely find Mori a charming and relatable guide to the world of <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Among-Others-Hugo-Award-Winner/dp/0765331721?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765331721" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Among Others</em></strong></a>, a place at once totally strange and achingly familiar.</p><p>
</p><p><br></p><p>

<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Night-Circus-Erin-Morgenstern/dp/0307744434?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0307744434" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Night Circus</em></strong></a> began as a stab at <a href="https://blog.reedsy.com/41-tips-for-nanowrimo/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>NaNoWriMo</strong></a>, but its success has long since transcended its origins. This romantic, quasi-Victorian confection of a fantasy takes place, predictably enough, at a circus that‚Äôs only open at night. The mysterious carnival has been prepared as the dazzling battleground for a duel between two magicians, Celia and Marco ‚Äî both raised as puppets in the rivalry between their two powerful mentors. But instead of giving their all to the coming battle, Celia and Marco have done something unforgivable: they‚Äôve fallen in love, and now must find a way to fulfill their contracts without killing each other.</p>

Chava is unmoored and adrift as the ship arrives in New York harbor in 1899.<br /><br />Ahmad is a jinni, a being of fire born in the ancient Syrian desert, trapped in an old copper flask, and released in New York City, though still not entirely free<br /><br />Ahmad and Chava become unlikely friends and soul mates with a mystical connection. <div class="blurb"><p>
This wildly imaginative historical fantasy involves an unexpected pair of <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/sea-monsters" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>magical creatures</strong></a> ‚Äî the titular golem and jinni, from Jewish and Arabic mythology respectively. The former, Chava, was brought to life by a wicked kabbalist to serve as a mail-order bride; the latter, Ahmad, lived for centuries inside a copper flask, only to end up as a tinsmith once freed. After a chance encounter in the 19th century, Chava and Ahmad become friends ‚Äî swapping stories on their struggles to pass as human. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Golem-Jinni-Novel-P-S/dp/0062110845?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0062110845" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Golem and the Jinni</em></strong></a> draws the reader in with a touching portrait of friendship while weaving in tantalizing threads of history and myth.¬†</p><p>

When his father dies and Jevick takes his place on the yearly selling trip to Olondria, Jevick's life is as close to perfect as he can imagine. But just as he revels in Olondria's Rabelaisian Feast of Birds, he is pulled drastically off course and becomes haunted by the ghost of an illiterate young girl.<br /><br />In desperation, Jevick seeks the aid of Olondrian priests and quickly becomes a pawn in the struggle between the empire's two most powerful cults. Yet even as the country shimmers on the cusp of war, he must face his ghost and learn her story before he has any chance of becoming free by setting <i>her</i> free: an ordeal that challenges his understanding of art and life, home and exile, and the limits of that seductive necromancy, reading.<br /><br /><i>A Stranger in Olondria</i> is a skillful and immersive debut fantasy novel that pulls the reader in deeper and deeper with twists and turns reminiscent of George R. <div class="blurb"><p>
This gorgeous debut novel turns fantasy into poetry, telling a story of hauntings both literal and figurative. It tracks the son of a pepper merchant, Jevick of Tyom, who finds himself in unwanted company ‚Äî he‚Äôs tailed by the ghost of an illiterate little girl. And when he seeks help from a group of exorcist-priests, Jevick quickly finds himself enmeshed in a power struggle that he never anticipated. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Stranger-Olondria-novel-Sofia-Samatar/dp/1931520763?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=1931520763" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>A Stranger in Olondria</em></strong></a> writes out the power of narrative in a way that‚Äôs human and moving, with just the right amount of meta.</p><p>

<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Bone-Clocks-Novel-David-Mitchell/dp/0812976827?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0812976827" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Bone Clocks</em></strong></a> shines with both literary pedigree and imaginative worldbuilding, up for both the Man Booker Prize <em>and</em> the World Fantasy Award in 2015. Its title hints at the darkly magical world we find inside ‚Äî ‚Äúbone clocks‚Äù are what immortals call the rest of us, ordinary humans whose bodies tick out the passage of time through their slow decay. We soon encounter two groups of immortals through a bone clock named Holly Sykes. But mortal as she is, Holly isn‚Äôt an ordinary young woman. Her psychic abilities make her a lightning rod for unusual phenomena ‚Äî and the eventual focal point for an epic supernatural war.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Buried-Giant-novel-Vintage-International-ebook/dp/B00N6PCXME?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00N6PCXME" data-book-info="{'title':'The Buried Giant: A novel (Vintage International)','slug':'the-buried-giant-a-novel-vintage-international-kazuo-ishiguro','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00N6PCXME?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51q1Xkr8UxL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51q1Xkr8UxL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Kazuo Ishiguro']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51q1Xkr8UxL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="305"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51q1Xkr8UxL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Buried Giant: A novel (Vintage International)" height="185"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>51. <em>The Buried Giant</em> by Kazuo Ishiguro (2015) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00N6PCXME?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00N6PCXME?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-buried-giant-a-novel-vintage-international-kazuo-ishiguro" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>Nobel laureate Kazuo Ishiguro penned this elegiac, post-Arthurian fantasy over the course of a difficult decade. The result was well worth the wait: <em>The Guardian‚Äô</em>s glowing review hailed it as ‚ÄúGame of Thrones with a conscience.‚Äù <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Buried-Giant-novel-Vintage-International-ebook/dp/B00N6PCXME?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00N6PCXME" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Buried Giant</em></strong></a><em> </em>considers the entanglement of old age, memory, and national history in a setting infused with the otherworld. At its center are an elderly couple named Axl and Beatrice, Briton villagers living in a world where King Arthur has died, leaving behind a seemingly durable peace. But everyone in Axl and Beatrice‚Äôs village continues to suffer: not from armed conflict, but from the mist, an amnesia that seems to have eaten away all their memories of a son they‚Äôre certain they‚Äôve lost.¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Fifth-Season-Broken-Earth-Book-ebook/dp/B00H25FCSQ?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00H25FCSQ" data-book-info="{'title':'The Fifth Season (The Broken Earth Book 1)','slug':'the-fifth-season-the-broken-earth-book-1-n-k-jemisin-ff9bb502-fa5f-43ea-9e66-dfda6035a620','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00H25FCSQ?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/617qBwl-A0L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/617qBwl-A0L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['N. K. Jemisin']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/617qBwl-A0L.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="285"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/617qBwl-A0L._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Fifth Season (The Broken Earth Book 1)" height="172"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>52. <em>The Fifth Season</em> by N.K. Jemisin (2015) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

<div class="blurb"><p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Fifth-Season-Broken-Earth-Book-ebook/dp/B00H25FCSQ?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00H25FCSQ" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Fifth Season</em></strong></a><em> </em>is perhaps N.K. Jemisin's most fully realized work, combining her trademark psychological complexity with an ultra-immersive world and a magic system of startling originality. It's set in a Pangaea-like supercontinent called the Stillness ‚Äî an ironic name, since the land is ravaged periodically by earthquakes. Because of this, the Stillness is a dangerous place for orogenes, who have the ability to control earthquakes and channel temperature. Called ‚Äúroggas‚Äù and savaged by mobs because of their dangerous powers, orogenes rarely make it to adulthood. But those who survive ‚Äî generally by hiding their abilities ‚Äî are herded towards a training facility called the Fulcrum, where they suffer oppressions of their own.¬†¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Grace-Kings-Dandelion-Dynasty-Book-ebook/dp/B00KU4O1CY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00KU4O1CY" data-book-info="{'title':'The Grace of Kings (The Dandelion Dynasty Book 1)','slug':'the-grace-of-kings-the-dandelion-dynasty-book-1-ken-liu','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00KU4O1CY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51b8eK2goBL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51b8eK2goBL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Ken Liu']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>The first installment in a planned trilogy, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Grace-Kings-Dandelion-Dynasty-Book-ebook/dp/B00KU4O1CY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00KU4O1CY" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Grace of Kings</em></strong></a> is entertaining as well as erudite. It‚Äôs already become a foundational work of the sensibility Liu terms <a href="https://io9.gizmodo.com/author-ken-liu-explains-silkpunk-to-us-1717812714" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>‚Äúsilkpunk‚Äù</strong></a>: an East Asian-inflected spin on steampunk that trades in gears and goggles for bamboo and paper. <em>The Grace of Kings</em> uses this silkpunk framework to rewrite some of the most exciting stories from a canonical Han-dynasty text. The result is a page-turner even for bookworms who don‚Äôt have knowledge of Chinese history¬†‚Äî and full of delightful easter eggs for those who do.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>

<div class="blurb"><p>In<a href="https://www.amazon.com/Sorcerer-Crown-Novel-Book-ebook/dp/B00SI0B91S?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00SI0B91S" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong> <em>A Sorcerer to the Crown</em></strong></a>, debut novelist Zen Cho serves up historical fantasy with humor and heart. Set in a magical version of Regency England, it's equal parts white-gloved gentility and side-splitting wit. But the story also tackles race with a deft touch: Zacharias Wythe is the new Sorcerer Royal of black African descent, and Prunella Gentleman is a biracial, magical finishing school drop-out. Together, they have to prevent an all-out war between powerful magical factions ‚Äî all while dealing with the constant indignities of prejudice.</p></div>

<div class="blurb"><p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/All-Birds-Charlie-Jane-Anders/dp/0765379953?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765379953" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>All the Birds in the Sky</em></strong></a> is a love story for nerds. Sparks fly between the compelling leads ‚Äî and between the two speculative genres they represent. Patricia Delfine, a witch, is fantasy. Her childhood friend Laurence Armstead, a gadgeteer, is science fiction. But after banding together against junior high bullies, the two lose touch: Patricia runs from witchcraft accusations to wind up in a school of magic, while Laurence is shipped off to military school to shape up among other ill-behaved teenage Muggles. Luckily, they reunite as adults ‚Äî just in time to tap into their combined skills to stop the Unraveling of the universe.</p></div>

<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01BKR487W?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01BKR487W?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="scythe-arc-of-a-scythe-book-1-neal-shusterman" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>In the world of Neal Shusterman's <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Scythe-Arc-Book-1-ebook/dp/B01BKR487W?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01BKR487W" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Scythe</em></strong></a><em>, </em>hyper-advanced technology has eliminated death by natural causes, rendering humans biologically immortal. But this seemingly utopian premise turns <em>dys</em>topian with the reality that overpopulation is still a problem ‚Äî and to cull it, a select group of citizens must act as ‚ÄúScythes‚Äù to determine who will live and die. This is the role taken on by our teenage protagonists, Citra and Rowan, who grapple with intense issues of mortality and morality as they train to be Scythes ‚Äî growing more suspicious all the while of inner-circle corruption that threatens to derail their society.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/City-Brass-Novel-Daevabad-Trilogy-ebook/dp/B06VXWPMV5?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B06VXWPMV5" data-book-info="{'title':'The City of Brass: A Novel (The Daevabad Trilogy)','slug':'the-city-of-brass-a-novel-the-daevabad-trilogy-s-a-chakraborty','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06VXWPMV5?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51C0Bj0imWL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51C0Bj0imWL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['S. A. Chakraborty']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51C0Bj0imWL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="297"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51C0Bj0imWL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The City of Brass: A Novel (The Daevabad Trilogy)" height="180"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>57. <em>The City of Brass</em> by S.A. Chakraborty¬†(2017) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06VXWPMV5?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06VXWPMV5?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-city-of-brass-a-novel-the-daevabad-trilogy-s-a-chakraborty" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>A dazzling fantasy set in the 18th-century Egypt, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/City-Brass-Novel-Daevabad-Trilogy-ebook/dp/B06VXWPMV5?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B06VXWPMV5" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The City of Brass</em></strong></a> wraps a tale of magical adventure around a core of Islamic mythology. But its heroine is a skeptic ‚Äî at first. A talented swindler with an instinct for healing, Nahri tricks Ottoman nobles into filling her purse by claiming magical powers she doesn‚Äôt actually have. Then one day, she fakes an exorcism... only to find herself face-to-face with a very real djinn. This unexpected new acquaintance, named Dara, spirits her away to the enchanted, brass-walled city of Daevabad. Here Nahri finds out the truth about her own heritage ‚Äî the key to her talent for the healing arts.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Jade-City-Green-Bone-Saga/dp/0316440884?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0316440884" data-book-info="{'title':'Jade City','slug':'jade-city-fonda-lee','synopsis':'<b>JADE CITY is </b><b>a gripping <i>Godfather</i>-esque saga of intergenerational blood feuds, vicious politics, magic, and kungfu.</b><br /><br />The Kaul family is one of two crime syndicates that control the island of Kekon. It's the only place in the world that produces rare magical jade, which grants those with the right training and heritage superhuman abilities. <br />The Green Bone clans of honorable jade-wearing warriors once protected the island from foreign invasion--but nowadays, in a bustling post-war metropolis full of fast cars and foreign money, Green Bone families like the Kauls are primarily involved in commerce, construction, and the everyday upkeep of the districts under their protection.<br /> When the simmering tension between the Kauls and their greatest rivals erupts into open violence in the streets, the outcome of this clan war will determine the fate of all Green Bones and the future of Kekon itself.','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0316440884?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1547625704l/43587154.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Fonda Lee']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>
<a href="https://www.amazon.com/Jade-City-Green-Bone-Saga/dp/0316440884?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0316440884" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Jade City</em></strong></a> reads like <em>Game of Thrones</em> meets <em>The Godfather</em>, with a modern, pan-Asian aesthetic all its own. In its vividly drawn magical underworld, organized crime centers around jade ‚Äî not the green jewel we know, but a mineral that grants superpowers to those who wield it, provided they have the right training and genes. After a cataclysmic conflict, the One Mountain Society that protected the island of Kekon has shattered into rival crime families. As they fight over the future of the jade trade, their battles spring to life in stunning fight sequences undergirded by Lee's martial arts knowledge and rich worldbuilding.¬†</p><p>
</p><p><br></p><p>
</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Ninth-House-Alex-Stern-Book-ebook/dp/B07LF64DZ2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07LF64DZ2" data-book-info="{'title':'Ninth House (Alex Stern Book 1)','slug':'ninth-house-alex-stern-book-1-leigh-bardugo','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07LF64DZ2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41cUxNtr5-L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41cUxNtr5-L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Leigh Bardugo']}" contenteditable="false">

</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>For anyone ever intrigued by the hush-hush and vaguely felonious undercurrents of Ivy League secret societies, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Ninth-House-Alex-Stern-Book-ebook/dp/B07LF64DZ2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07LF64DZ2" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Ninth House</em></strong></a> is the novel to sate your imagination. It kicks off with 20-year-old Alex Stern, ghost-seer and sole survivor of a brutal homicide, receiving a full-ride scholarship to Yale ‚Äî under the condition that she use her spiritually perceptive powers to monitor the university's eight Houses of the Vale. As part of the titular ninth house, Lethe, Alex must work to uncover the magical abuses of these occult organizations ‚Äî but what she can't know is how dark things will get, and how deeply she's enmeshed in them already.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NCQ6RJG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-book-info="{'title':'Starsight (Skyward Book 2)','slug':'starsight-skyward-book-2-brandon-sanderson','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NCQ6RJG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUy3F+G8L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUy3F+G8L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Brandon Sanderson']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="true">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Finally we've arrived at <a href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NCQ6RJG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Starsight</em></strong></a><em>, </em>the most recent undertaking by fantasy phenom Brandon Sanderson. In this outer-space spectacular, Sanderson seamlessly picks up the narrative thread of Spensa Nightshade ‚Äî a passionate, psychically gifted young pilot who's become a key weapon in the human war against the alien Krell. Here, Spensa embarks on a dangerous undercover mission to steal a Krell hyperdrive, but what will happen when her true identity is revealed? (Our only advisory before diving headfirst into <em>Starsight </em>is to read the previous installment, <em>Skyward, </em>first ‚Äî especially if you have an <em>Ender's Game</em>-shaped hole in your life.)</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
