</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Name-Wind-Kingkiller-Chronicle-Book-ebook/dp/B0010SKUYM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B0010SKUYM" data-book-info="{'title':'The Name of the Wind (The Kingkiller Chronicle Book 1)','slug':'the-name-of-the-wind-the-kingkiller-chronicle-book-1-patrick-rothfuss','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0010SKUYM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51MUF7bj-lL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51MUF7bj-lL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Patrick Rothfuss']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51MUF7bj-lL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="297"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51MUF7bj-lL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Name of the Wind (The Kingkiller Chronicle Book 1)" height="180"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>41. <em>The Name of the Wind</em> by Patrick Rothfuss (2007) </strong></h2></div>

<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Name-Wind-Kingkiller-Chronicle-Book-ebook/dp/B0010SKUYM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B0010SKUYM" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Name of the Wind</em></strong></a> boasts another complicated framework narrative that, in this case, turns the entire work into a meditation on the importance of storytelling. It‚Äôs told as a fictional autobiography whose subject ‚Äî and narrator ‚Äî is the legendary culture-hero Kvothe, living incognito at the novel‚Äôs beginning as a humble innkeeper. But his cover‚Äôs blown following the appearance, in the flesh, of a demon long relegated to the realm of myths. Long story short ‚Äî or if you read the whole thing, long story long ‚Äî Kvothe ends up recounting the submerged stories of his past, from his magical education to his myriad heartbreaks.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Magicians-Novel-Lev-Grossman-ebook/dp/B002AU7MJU?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002AU7MJU" data-book-info="{'title':'The Magicians: A Novel','slug':'the-magicians-a-novel-lev-grossman-fa928888-b1ad-454b-8408-b0e06abed8b9','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002AU7MJU?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/511xS-QCd2L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/511xS-QCd2L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Lev Grossman']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/511xS-QCd2L.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="303"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/511xS-QCd2L._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Magicians: A Novel" height="184"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>42. <em>The Magicians</em> by Lev Grossman (2009) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This high fantasy novel (in the guise of <em>New Yorker</em>-friendly lit fic) follows a high school senior named Quentin, who finds his way into magic college en route to his Princeton interview. But there are no sun-drenched Quidditch matches at Brakebills: instead, the curriculum turns on classical philology and the memorization of magical hand positions. Indeed, between this and its frank treatment of sexuality and mental health, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Magicians-Novel-Lev-Grossman-ebook/dp/B002AU7MJU?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002AU7MJU" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Magicians</em></strong></a> has often been touted as a ‚ÄúHarry Potter for grownups.‚Äù And if you‚Äôre more Ravenclaw than Gryffindor, you might find yourself daydreaming about Brakebills instead of Hogwarts ‚Äî at least until Grossman deconstructs the trope of the magical boarding school with devastating acuity.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Under-Heaven-Guy-Gavriel-Kay-ebook/dp/B003NX7NEM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B003NX7NEM" data-book-info="{'title':'Under Heaven','slug':'under-heaven-guy-gavriel-kay-a6a4a764-377e-47cd-a396-59999ae5b0ec','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003NX7NEM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUv610dYL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUv610dYL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Guy Gavriel Kay']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

      </g>

  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Guy Gavriel Kay is a sorcerer in the realm of alternate history ‚Äî his usual M.O. entails magic-drenched versions of ancient Constantinople or Renaissance Italy. In <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Under-Heaven-Guy-Gavriel-Kay-ebook/dp/B003NX7NEM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B003NX7NEM" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Under Heaven</em></strong></a>, Kay turns his talents to medieval China, with a version of the country called Kitai having recently achieved a hard-fought peace. Shen Tai, the second son of a legendary general, takes advantage of the ceasefire to bury the long-abandoned dead: both his own Kitai countrymen and their Taguran enemies, whose ghosts still haunt the site of their fatal defeats. In response, the Taguran empress gifts him a herd of 250 prized horses ‚Äî making him an immediate target in the next round of Kitai political intrigues.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Hundred-Thousand-Kingdoms-Inheritance-Trilogy-ebook/dp/B002ZDJZO2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002ZDJZO2" data-book-info="{'title':'The Hundred Thousand Kingdoms (The Inheritance Trilogy Book 1)','slug':'the-hundred-thousand-kingdoms-the-inheritance-trilogy-book-1-n-k-jemisin','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002ZDJZO2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Y9jDo536L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Y9jDo536L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['N.K. Jemisin']}" contenteditable="false">

Jemisin (2010) </strong></h2></div>

  </span>

</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>These days, N.K. Jemisin is a bona fide thought leader who writes full-time, but <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Hundred-Thousand-Kingdoms-Inheritance-Trilogy-ebook/dp/B002ZDJZO2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002ZDJZO2" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Hundred Thousand Kingdoms</em></strong></a> was the match that sparked her incandescent career. It opens as such: following her mother's death, a biracial woman named Yeine Darr is summoned to the floating city of Sky and told she‚Äôs descended from Sky‚Äôs ruling house. But on her father‚Äôs side, she belongs to the Darre ‚Äî a people considered barbarians by her mother's kin. This revelation pulls her into a struggle of succession and identity, all of which Yeine must navigate as she tries to solve her mother's mysterious murder.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Who-Fears-Death-Nnedi-Okorafor/dp/0756407281?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0756407281" data-book-info="{'title':'Who Fears Death','slug':'who-fears-death-nnedi-okorafor-74b87f46-eef7-48fc-9e00-f2af006a2330','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0756407281?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41w2vCvbgRL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41w2vCvbgRL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Nnedi Okorafor']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/0756407281?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/0756407281?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="who-fears-death-nnedi-okorafor-74b87f46-eef7-48fc-9e00-f2af006a2330" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This searing novel is rooted in the real-life tragedy of weaponized rape in the Darfur conflict, which Okorafor read about just as she was beginning work on it. The narrator of <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Who-Fears-Death-Nnedi-Okorafor/dp/0756407281?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0756407281" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Who Fears Death</em></strong></a>, Onyesonwu, is the product of similar racial violence; she's born to an Okeke woman, raped by the light-skinned Nuru sorcerer responsible for the massacre of her village. Named for a question ‚Äî ‚ÄúWho Fears Death?‚Äù‚Äî¬†she develops magical gifts to rival her wicked father‚Äôs. And after honing her abilities under the tutelage of a powerful shaman, Onyesonwu takes on a quest: to end the genocide of her mother‚Äôs people forever.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Among-Others-Hugo-Award-Winner/dp/0765331721?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765331721" data-book-info="{'title':'Among Others','slug':'among-others-jo-walton-7b178b59-cd7d-4088-9ed5-6828ee439686','synopsis':'Startling, unusual, and irresistibly readable, <i>Among Others </i>is at once the compelling story of a young woman struggling to escape a troubled childhood, a brilliant diary of first encounters with the great novels of modern fantasy and science fiction, and a spellbinding tale of escape from ancient enchantment.<br /><br />As a child growing up in Wales, Morwenna played among the spirits who made their homes in industrial ruins. But her mind found freedom in the science fiction novels that were her closest companions. When her half-mad mother tried to bend the spirits to dark ends, Mori was forced to confront her in a magical battle that left her crippled--and her twin sister dead.<br /><br />Fleeing to a father whom she barely knew, Mori was sent to boarding school in England--a place all but devoid of true magic. There, she tempted fate by doing magic herself, in an attempt to find a circle of like-minded friends. But her magic also drew the attention of her mother, bringing about a reckoning that could no longer be put off...<br /><br />Combining elements of autobiography with flights of imagination, this is a stunning new novel by an author whose genius has already been hailed by dozens of her peers.','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0765331721?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1327010385l/11669085.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Jo Walton']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1327010385l/11669085.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="296"><img data-srcset="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1327010385l/11669085.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="Among Others" height="179"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>46. <em>Among Others</em> by Jo Walton (2011) </strong></h2></div>

<div class="blurb"><p>
This inventive, award-winning book portrays the coming-of-age of Morwenna Phelps, a teenager who recently lost both her twin and the use of her legs thanks to a magical accident. Her story is refracted in a charmingly meta fashion, and has a comforting familiarity of form, as we see everything through Mori‚Äôs journal entries ‚Äî where she vents about math classes, bra shopping, and first love along with the difficulties of spell-casting. If you‚Äôre into quirky, genre-bending works, you‚Äôll definitely find Mori a charming and relatable guide to the world of <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Among-Others-Hugo-Award-Winner/dp/0765331721?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765331721" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Among Others</em></strong></a>, a place at once totally strange and achingly familiar.</p><p>
</p><p><br></p><p>

<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Night-Circus-Erin-Morgenstern/dp/0307744434?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0307744434" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Night Circus</em></strong></a> began as a stab at <a href="https://blog.reedsy.com/41-tips-for-nanowrimo/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>NaNoWriMo</strong></a>, but its success has long since transcended its origins. This romantic, quasi-Victorian confection of a fantasy takes place, predictably enough, at a circus that‚Äôs only open at night. The mysterious carnival has been prepared as the dazzling battleground for a duel between two magicians, Celia and Marco ‚Äî both raised as puppets in the rivalry between their two powerful mentors. But instead of giving their all to the coming battle, Celia and Marco have done something unforgivable: they‚Äôve fallen in love, and now must find a way to fulfill their contracts without killing each other.</p>

</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Golem-Jinni-Novel-P-S/dp/0062110845?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0062110845" data-book-info="{'title':'The Golem and the Jinni','slug':'the-golem-and-the-jinni-helene-wecker-d03043a0-6b54-47fc-a52d-6ddedf1260dc','synopsis':'<strong>?In <em>The Golem and the Jinni, </em>a chance meeting between mythical beings takes readers on a dazzling journey through cultures in turn-of-the-century New York.</strong><br /><br />Chava is a golem, a creature made of clay, brought to life to by a disgraced rabbi who dabbles in dark Kabbalistic magic and dies at sea on the voyage from Poland. Chava is unmoored and adrift as the ship arrives in New York harbor in 1899.<br /><br />Ahmad is a jinni, a being of fire born in the ancient Syrian desert, trapped in an old copper flask, and released in New York City, though still not entirely free<br /><br />Ahmad and Chava become unlikely friends and soul mates with a mystical connection. Marvelous and compulsively readable, Helene Wecker's debut novel <em>The Golem and the Jinni </em>weaves strands of Yiddish and Middle Eastern literature, historical fiction and magical fable, into a wondrously inventive and unforgettable tale.','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0062110845?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1387308859l/18148202.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Helene Wecker']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>
This wildly imaginative historical fantasy involves an unexpected pair of <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/sea-monsters" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>magical creatures</strong></a> ‚Äî the titular golem and jinni, from Jewish and Arabic mythology respectively. The former, Chava, was brought to life by a wicked kabbalist to serve as a mail-order bride; the latter, Ahmad, lived for centuries inside a copper flask, only to end up as a tinsmith once freed. After a chance encounter in the 19th century, Chava and Ahmad become friends ‚Äî swapping stories on their struggles to pass as human. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Golem-Jinni-Novel-P-S/dp/0062110845?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0062110845" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Golem and the Jinni</em></strong></a> draws the reader in with a touching portrait of friendship while weaving in tantalizing threads of history and myth.¬†</p><p>
</p><p><br></p><p>

</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Stranger-Olondria-novel-Sofia-Samatar/dp/1931520763?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=1931520763" data-book-info="{'title':'A Stranger in Olondria','slug':'a-stranger-in-olondria-sofia-samatar','synopsis':'Jevick, the pepper merchant's son, has been raised on stories of Olondria, a distant land where books are as common as they are rare in his home. When his father dies and Jevick takes his place on the yearly selling trip to Olondria, Jevick's life is as close to perfect as he can imagine. But just as he revels in Olondria's Rabelaisian Feast of Birds, he is pulled drastically off course and becomes haunted by the ghost of an illiterate young girl.<br /><br />In desperation, Jevick seeks the aid of Olondrian priests and quickly becomes a pawn in the struggle between the empire's two most powerful cults. Yet even as the country shimmers on the cusp of war, he must face his ghost and learn her story before he has any chance of becoming free by setting <i>her</i> free: an ordeal that challenges his understanding of art and life, home and exile, and the limits of that seductive necromancy, reading.<br /><br /><i>A Stranger in Olondria</i> is a skillful and immersive debut fantasy novel that pulls the reader in deeper and deeper with twists and turns reminiscent of George R. R. Martin and Joe Hill.<br /><br /><b>Sofia Samatar</b> is an American of Somali and Swiss German Mennonite background. She wrote <i>A Stranger in Olondria</i> in Yambio, south Sudan, where she worked as an English teacher. She has worked in Egypt and is pursuing a PhD in African languages and literature at the University of Madison, Wisconsin.','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/1931520763?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1342108396l/12814333.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Sofia Samatar']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>
This gorgeous debut novel turns fantasy into poetry, telling a story of hauntings both literal and figurative. It tracks the son of a pepper merchant, Jevick of Tyom, who finds himself in unwanted company ‚Äî he‚Äôs tailed by the ghost of an illiterate little girl. And when he seeks help from a group of exorcist-priests, Jevick quickly finds himself enmeshed in a power struggle that he never anticipated. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Stranger-Olondria-novel-Sofia-Samatar/dp/1931520763?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=1931520763" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>A Stranger in Olondria</em></strong></a> writes out the power of narrative in a way that‚Äôs human and moving, with just the right amount of meta.</p><p>

<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Bone-Clocks-Novel-David-Mitchell/dp/0812976827?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0812976827" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Bone Clocks</em></strong></a> shines with both literary pedigree and imaginative worldbuilding, up for both the Man Booker Prize <em>and</em> the World Fantasy Award in 2015. Its title hints at the darkly magical world we find inside ‚Äî ‚Äúbone clocks‚Äù are what immortals call the rest of us, ordinary humans whose bodies tick out the passage of time through their slow decay. We soon encounter two groups of immortals through a bone clock named Holly Sykes. But mortal as she is, Holly isn‚Äôt an ordinary young woman. Her psychic abilities make her a lightning rod for unusual phenomena ‚Äî and the eventual focal point for an epic supernatural war.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Buried-Giant-novel-Vintage-International-ebook/dp/B00N6PCXME?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00N6PCXME" data-book-info="{'title':'The Buried Giant: A novel (Vintage International)','slug':'the-buried-giant-a-novel-vintage-international-kazuo-ishiguro','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00N6PCXME?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51q1Xkr8UxL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51q1Xkr8UxL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Kazuo Ishiguro']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51q1Xkr8UxL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="305"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51q1Xkr8UxL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Buried Giant: A novel (Vintage International)" height="185"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>51. <em>The Buried Giant</em> by Kazuo Ishiguro (2015) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00N6PCXME?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00N6PCXME?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-buried-giant-a-novel-vintage-international-kazuo-ishiguro" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>Nobel laureate Kazuo Ishiguro penned this elegiac, post-Arthurian fantasy over the course of a difficult decade. The result was well worth the wait: <em>The Guardian‚Äô</em>s glowing review hailed it as ‚ÄúGame of Thrones with a conscience.‚Äù <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Buried-Giant-novel-Vintage-International-ebook/dp/B00N6PCXME?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00N6PCXME" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Buried Giant</em></strong></a><em> </em>considers the entanglement of old age, memory, and national history in a setting infused with the otherworld. At its center are an elderly couple named Axl and Beatrice, Briton villagers living in a world where King Arthur has died, leaving behind a seemingly durable peace. But everyone in Axl and Beatrice‚Äôs village continues to suffer: not from armed conflict, but from the mist, an amnesia that seems to have eaten away all their memories of a son they‚Äôre certain they‚Äôve lost.¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Fifth-Season-Broken-Earth-Book-ebook/dp/B00H25FCSQ?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00H25FCSQ" data-book-info="{'title':'The Fifth Season (The Broken Earth Book 1)','slug':'the-fifth-season-the-broken-earth-book-1-n-k-jemisin-ff9bb502-fa5f-43ea-9e66-dfda6035a620','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00H25FCSQ?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/617qBwl-A0L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/617qBwl-A0L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['N. K. Jemisin']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/617qBwl-A0L.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="285"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/617qBwl-A0L._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Fifth Season (The Broken Earth Book 1)" height="172"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>52. <em>The Fifth Season</em> by N.K. Jemisin (2015) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

<div class="blurb"><p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Fifth-Season-Broken-Earth-Book-ebook/dp/B00H25FCSQ?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00H25FCSQ" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Fifth Season</em></strong></a><em> </em>is perhaps N.K. Jemisin's most fully realized work, combining her trademark psychological complexity with an ultra-immersive world and a magic system of startling originality. It's set in a Pangaea-like supercontinent called the Stillness ‚Äî an ironic name, since the land is ravaged periodically by earthquakes. Because of this, the Stillness is a dangerous place for orogenes, who have the ability to control earthquakes and channel temperature. Called ‚Äúroggas‚Äù and savaged by mobs because of their dangerous powers, orogenes rarely make it to adulthood. But those who survive ‚Äî generally by hiding their abilities ‚Äî are herded towards a training facility called the Fulcrum, where they suffer oppressions of their own.¬†¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Grace-Kings-Dandelion-Dynasty-Book-ebook/dp/B00KU4O1CY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00KU4O1CY" data-book-info="{'title':'The Grace of Kings (The Dandelion Dynasty Book 1)','slug':'the-grace-of-kings-the-dandelion-dynasty-book-1-ken-liu','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00KU4O1CY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51b8eK2goBL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51b8eK2goBL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Ken Liu']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>The first installment in a planned trilogy, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Grace-Kings-Dandelion-Dynasty-Book-ebook/dp/B00KU4O1CY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00KU4O1CY" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Grace of Kings</em></strong></a> is entertaining as well as erudite. It‚Äôs already become a foundational work of the sensibility Liu terms <a href="https://io9.gizmodo.com/author-ken-liu-explains-silkpunk-to-us-1717812714" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>‚Äúsilkpunk‚Äù</strong></a>: an East Asian-inflected spin on steampunk that trades in gears and goggles for bamboo and paper. <em>The Grace of Kings</em> uses this silkpunk framework to rewrite some of the most exciting stories from a canonical Han-dynasty text. The result is a page-turner even for bookworms who don‚Äôt have knowledge of Chinese history¬†‚Äî and full of delightful easter eggs for those who do.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>

<div class="blurb"><p>In<a href="https://www.amazon.com/Sorcerer-Crown-Novel-Book-ebook/dp/B00SI0B91S?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00SI0B91S" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong> <em>A Sorcerer to the Crown</em></strong></a>, debut novelist Zen Cho serves up historical fantasy with humor and heart. Set in a magical version of Regency England, it's equal parts white-gloved gentility and side-splitting wit. But the story also tackles race with a deft touch: Zacharias Wythe is the new Sorcerer Royal of black African descent, and Prunella Gentleman is a biracial, magical finishing school drop-out. Together, they have to prevent an all-out war between powerful magical factions ‚Äî all while dealing with the constant indignities of prejudice.</p></div>

<div class="blurb"><p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/All-Birds-Charlie-Jane-Anders/dp/0765379953?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765379953" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>All the Birds in the Sky</em></strong></a> is a love story for nerds. Sparks fly between the compelling leads ‚Äî and between the two speculative genres they represent. Patricia Delfine, a witch, is fantasy. Her childhood friend Laurence Armstead, a gadgeteer, is science fiction. But after banding together against junior high bullies, the two lose touch: Patricia runs from witchcraft accusations to wind up in a school of magic, while Laurence is shipped off to military school to shape up among other ill-behaved teenage Muggles. Luckily, they reunite as adults ‚Äî just in time to tap into their combined skills to stop the Unraveling of the universe.</p></div>

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01BKR487W?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01BKR487W?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="scythe-arc-of-a-scythe-book-1-neal-shusterman" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>In the world of Neal Shusterman's <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Scythe-Arc-Book-1-ebook/dp/B01BKR487W?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01BKR487W" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Scythe</em></strong></a><em>, </em>hyper-advanced technology has eliminated death by natural causes, rendering humans biologically immortal. But this seemingly utopian premise turns <em>dys</em>topian with the reality that overpopulation is still a problem ‚Äî and to cull it, a select group of citizens must act as ‚ÄúScythes‚Äù to determine who will live and die. This is the role taken on by our teenage protagonists, Citra and Rowan, who grapple with intense issues of mortality and morality as they train to be Scythes ‚Äî growing more suspicious all the while of inner-circle corruption that threatens to derail their society.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/City-Brass-Novel-Daevabad-Trilogy-ebook/dp/B06VXWPMV5?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B06VXWPMV5" data-book-info="{'title':'The City of Brass: A Novel (The Daevabad Trilogy)','slug':'the-city-of-brass-a-novel-the-daevabad-trilogy-s-a-chakraborty','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06VXWPMV5?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51C0Bj0imWL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51C0Bj0imWL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['S. A. Chakraborty']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51C0Bj0imWL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="297"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51C0Bj0imWL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The City of Brass: A Novel (The Daevabad Trilogy)" height="180"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>57. <em>The City of Brass</em> by S.A. Chakraborty¬†(2017) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06VXWPMV5?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06VXWPMV5?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-city-of-brass-a-novel-the-daevabad-trilogy-s-a-chakraborty" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>A dazzling fantasy set in the 18th-century Egypt, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/City-Brass-Novel-Daevabad-Trilogy-ebook/dp/B06VXWPMV5?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B06VXWPMV5" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The City of Brass</em></strong></a> wraps a tale of magical adventure around a core of Islamic mythology. But its heroine is a skeptic ‚Äî at first. A talented swindler with an instinct for healing, Nahri tricks Ottoman nobles into filling her purse by claiming magical powers she doesn‚Äôt actually have. Then one day, she fakes an exorcism... only to find herself face-to-face with a very real djinn. This unexpected new acquaintance, named Dara, spirits her away to the enchanted, brass-walled city of Daevabad. Here Nahri finds out the truth about her own heritage ‚Äî the key to her talent for the healing arts.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Jade-City-Green-Bone-Saga/dp/0316440884?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0316440884" data-book-info="{'title':'Jade City','slug':'jade-city-fonda-lee','synopsis':'<b>JADE CITY is </b><b>a gripping <i>Godfather</i>-esque saga of intergenerational blood feuds, vicious politics, magic, and kungfu.</b><br /><br />The Kaul family is one of two crime syndicates that control the island of Kekon. It's the only place in the world that produces rare magical jade, which grants those with the right training and heritage superhuman abilities. <br />The Green Bone clans of honorable jade-wearing warriors once protected the island from foreign invasion--but nowadays, in a bustling post-war metropolis full of fast cars and foreign money, Green Bone families like the Kauls are primarily involved in commerce, construction, and the everyday upkeep of the districts under their protection.<br /> When the simmering tension between the Kauls and their greatest rivals erupts into open violence in the streets, the outcome of this clan war will determine the fate of all Green Bones and the future of Kekon itself.','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0316440884?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1547625704l/43587154.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Fonda Lee']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>
<a href="https://www.amazon.com/Jade-City-Green-Bone-Saga/dp/0316440884?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0316440884" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Jade City</em></strong></a> reads like <em>Game of Thrones</em> meets <em>The Godfather</em>, with a modern, pan-Asian aesthetic all its own. In its vividly drawn magical underworld, organized crime centers around jade ‚Äî not the green jewel we know, but a mineral that grants superpowers to those who wield it, provided they have the right training and genes. After a cataclysmic conflict, the One Mountain Society that protected the island of Kekon has shattered into rival crime families. As they fight over the future of the jade trade, their battles spring to life in stunning fight sequences undergirded by Lee's martial arts knowledge and rich worldbuilding.¬†</p><p>
</p><p><br></p><p>
</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Ninth-House-Alex-Stern-Book-ebook/dp/B07LF64DZ2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07LF64DZ2" data-book-info="{'title':'Ninth House (Alex Stern Book 1)','slug':'ninth-house-alex-stern-book-1-leigh-bardugo','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07LF64DZ2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41cUxNtr5-L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41cUxNtr5-L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Leigh Bardugo']}" contenteditable="false">

</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>For anyone ever intrigued by the hush-hush and vaguely felonious undercurrents of Ivy League secret societies, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Ninth-House-Alex-Stern-Book-ebook/dp/B07LF64DZ2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07LF64DZ2" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Ninth House</em></strong></a> is the novel to sate your imagination. It kicks off with 20-year-old Alex Stern, ghost-seer and sole survivor of a brutal homicide, receiving a full-ride scholarship to Yale ‚Äî under the condition that she use her spiritually perceptive powers to monitor the university's eight Houses of the Vale. As part of the titular ninth house, Lethe, Alex must work to uncover the magical abuses of these occult organizations ‚Äî but what she can't know is how dark things will get, and how deeply she's enmeshed in them already.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NCQ6RJG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-book-info="{'title':'Starsight (Skyward Book 2)','slug':'starsight-skyward-book-2-brandon-sanderson','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NCQ6RJG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUy3F+G8L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUy3F+G8L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Brandon Sanderson']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="true">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Finally we've arrived at <a href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NCQ6RJG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Starsight</em></strong></a><em>, </em>the most recent undertaking by fantasy phenom Brandon Sanderson. In this outer-space spectacular, Sanderson seamlessly picks up the narrative thread of Spensa Nightshade ‚Äî a passionate, psychically gifted young pilot who's become a key weapon in the human war against the alien Krell. Here, Spensa embarks on a dangerous undercover mission to steal a Krell hyperdrive, but what will happen when her true identity is revealed? (Our only advisory before diving headfirst into <em>Starsight </em>is to read the previous installment, <em>Skyward, </em>first ‚Äî especially if you have an <em>Ender's Game</em>-shaped hole in your life.)</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>

>
  <p>

</p><p>Whether you‚Äôve sat around waiting for your Hogwarts letter or looked for Narnia in the back of a closet, you've probably dreamt of stepping into your favorite fantasy books and leaving the real world behind. But the genre isn‚Äôt all witches, wardrobes, and whimsy! Beyond offering temporary escape from the pressures of daily life, the best fantasy books help us confront them.¬†</p><p>
</p><p>Stories of the otherworldly allow readers to make sense of <em>this</em> world, refracting change, wickedness, and heartache through a magical lens so we can see them all more clearly ‚Äî and face them head-on. A good fantasy book illuminates the mind with childlike wonder, but also lingers in our memories because of its connection to real life.</p><p>
</p><p>In other words, great fantasy books show us the world in another guise, yet each is also a universe unto itself. We hope you enjoy exploring them in this list of the best fantasy books of all time!</p><p>
</p><p><strong><em>If you're feeling overwhelmed by the number of amazing fantasy books on hand, you can also take our 30-second quiz below to narrow it down quickly and get a personalized fantasy series recommendation¬†</em></strong>üòâ</p><p><div class="typeform panel">
  <div class="panel-body text-center">
    <p class="h1 space-bottom-xs">
      üìö
    </p>
    <h3 class="h2">
      Which fantasy series should you read next?

<div class="blurb"><p>Even if you‚Äôre not a math geek, you‚Äôre probably familiar with the algebraist Charles Dodgson ‚Äî you just know him his much more famous alter-ego, Lewis Carroll. Unlike Dodgson, Carroll wrote stories that <em>defied</em> logic, twisting it into dreamlike, fantastical shapes: a hookah-smoking caterpillar, a flamingo-filled croquet-ground, a perpetually tardy White Rabbit. The result was <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Alices-Adventures-Wonderland-AmazonClassics-Carroll-ebook/dp/B071RSDB49?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B071RSDB49" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Alice's Adventures in Wonderland</em></strong></a><em>, </em>which has delighted adults and children alike since it was published over a century and a half ago ‚Äî and today is recognized as a momentous early foray into the fantasy genre as a whole.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/King-Elflands-Daughter-Lord-Dunsany-ebook/dp/B01DI5KIDC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01DI5KIDC" data-book-info="{'title':'The King of Elfland's Daughter','slug':'the-king-of-elfland-s-daughter-lord-dunsany-571ac16d-a18f-4019-a35a-de710f307347','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01DI5KIDC?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51k4iQZf8jL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51k4iQZf8jL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Lord Dunsany']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/King-Elflands-Daughter-Lord-Dunsany-ebook/dp/B01DI5KIDC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01DI5KIDC" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The King of Elfland‚Äôs Daughter</em></strong></a> is a fairy tale with deep, dark roots ‚Äî as well as a love story rendered with piercing emotional honesty. It‚Äôs also an unlikely immigration novel, about an elfin princess‚Äôs attempts to deal with her fractured sense of self as she adjusts to the homeland of her beloved human husband.¬†Another remarkably early entry into the fantasy genre, this book prompted Arthur C. Clarke to name Dunsany as one of the greatest writers of his century, and World Fantasy Award winner Jane Yolen to call him ‚Äúthe great grandfather of us all.‚Äù</p></div>
</div><p>

Tolkien']}" contenteditable="false">

Tolkien (1937) </strong></h2></div>

  <span class="dui-icon icon-sm">
    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>It might be a childhood favorite, but <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Hobbit-Lord-Rings-J-R-R-Tolkien-ebook/dp/B0079KT81G?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B0079KT81G" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Hobbit</em></strong></a> gives adult fantasy readers one of the genre‚Äôs most relatable protagonists: a middle-aged homebody who just wants to chill. The iconic Bilbo Baggins speaks to all grownup introverts who like nothing more than a good meal and a cozy chair. But we all hope we‚Äôd find Bilbo-like reservoirs of heroism within us ‚Äî yes, while a career as a Chosen One might be out of reach for us, we can all aspire to be Bilbo Baggins.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>

H. White']}" contenteditable="false">

White (1938) </strong></h2></div>

<div class="blurb"><p>We all know what happens <em>after </em>King Arthur pulls the sword out of the stone; <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Sword-Stone-Essential-Modern-Classics/dp/000726349X?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=000726349X" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Sword in the Stone</em></strong></a> takes a look at the <em>before</em>. Predictably, it‚Äôs much less glamorous. In this telling, the archetypical fantasy monarch was once just a boy called Wart ‚Äî¬†teased by his foster-brother Kay and subjected to a punishing round of lessons that would make any modern high-schooler wince in sympathy. Only Wart‚Äôs education doesn‚Äôt involve AP Calculus and JV Track... and his teacher, Merlyn, prefers to instruct by turning his students into animals instead of grilling them with the Socratic method.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Lion-Witch-Wardrobe-Chronicles-Narnia-ebook/dp/B001I45UFC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B001I45UFC" data-book-info="{'title':'The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe (Chronicles of Narnia Book 2)','slug':'the-lion-the-witch-and-the-wardrobe-chronicles-of-narnia-book-2-c-s-lewis','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B001I45UFC?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51hQ4EstmyL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51hQ4EstmyL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['C.S. <div class="blurb">
<p>When the four Pevensie siblings leave bomb-ravaged London to wait out World War II in the countryside, they discover a portal to the magical land of Narnia behind a pile of fur coats. But their magical new vacation spot suffers from bad leadership: it‚Äôs governed by a witch whose only policy decisions are about ensuring eternal winter with no Christmas cheer. The Pevensies have to oust her ‚Äî with the help of a talking lion! If you‚Äôre a fantasy buff, you‚Äôll already know that the lion is a Christological stand-in, and that <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Lion-Witch-Wardrobe-Chronicles-Narnia-ebook/dp/B001I45UFC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B001I45UFC" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe</em></strong></a> is a meditation on redemption, sacrifice, and faith. But you don‚Äôt need to worship anything to want to drop in on Narnia for an hour or two.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>

</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Master-Margarita-Mikhail-Bulgakov-ebook/dp/B01DV1Y7D0?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01DV1Y7D0" data-book-info="{'title':'The Master and Margarita','slug':'the-master-and-margarita-mikhail-bulgakov-abf670ca-a1bc-4dad-a1d2-be0e73ac6bf6','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01DV1Y7D0?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lLMPTPDDL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lLMPTPDDL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Mikhail Bulgakov','Mirra Ginsburg']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb">
<p>Like the first five books on this list, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Master-Margarita-Mikhail-Bulgakov-ebook/dp/B01DV1Y7D0?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01DV1Y7D0" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Master and Margarita</em></strong></a> is often considered one of the 20th century‚Äôs finest novels. Unlike them, it‚Äôs <em>definitely</em> not for kids. Written at the height of Stalinist repression, it braids together two narrative strands: one a psychologically subtle take on the death of Christ, the other a devilish satire on Soviet intellectual life. And where does the mysterious Muscovian author, known only as the Master, fall in all of this? In reality, fearful of political repression, Mikhail Bulgakov fed his first attempt at this  story to the flames; fortunately for Russophiles and demonologists everywhere, he gave it another try.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>

<div class="blurb">
<p>With its shimmering, lilac-scented prose, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Last-Unicorn-Peter-S-Beagle-ebook/dp/B007EZJKS2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B007EZJKS2" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Last Unicorn</em></strong></a> treads the line between novel and poetry ‚Äî¬†reading with the ease of a bedtime story and the depth of an allegory. In this gossamer world, we meet an immortal Unicorn, who‚Äôs grieved to learn from a hunting party that she might be the last of her kind. Upon leaving her enchanted forest to investigate their claims, she finds that humans perceive her as an ordinary white horse. The Unicorn‚Äôs wanderings put her in the company of ringmasters and harpies, magicians and kings: some who want to harm her, and some who do their best to help.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Wizard-Earthsea-Cycle-Book-ebook/dp/B008T9L6AM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B008T9L6AM" data-book-info="{'title':'A Wizard of Earthsea (The Earthsea Cycle Series Book 1)','slug':'a-wizard-of-earthsea-the-earthsea-cycle-series-book-1-ursula-k-le-guin','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B008T9L6AM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yBOHJFBqL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yBOHJFBqL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Ursula K. Le Guin (1968) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B008T9L6AM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B008T9L6AM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="a-wizard-of-earthsea-the-earthsea-cycle-series-book-1-ursula-k-le-guin" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>On a dense cluster of islands, inhabited by dragons and raised out of the water by a god, master fantasist Ursula K. Le Guin spins out elegant, character-driven tales, enriched by her knowledge of world mythology. Her first installment in the <em>Earthsea </em>series, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Wizard-Earthsea-Cycle-Book-ebook/dp/B008T9L6AM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B008T9L6AM" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>A Wizard of Earthsea</em></strong></a><em>,</em> is a bildungsroman of the old school, albeit enlivened with wizardry: a magical coming-of-age that treats hefty themes like death, the environment, and cosmic balance ‚Äî all with Le Guin‚Äôs characteristically deft touch.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Fellowship-Ring-Being-First-Rings-ebook/dp/B007978NPG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B007978NPG" data-book-info="{'title':'The Fellowship of the Ring: Being the First Part of The Lord of the Rings','slug':'the-fellowship-of-the-ring-being-the-first-part-of-the-lord-of-the-rings-j-r-r-tolkien','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007978NPG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41kUPvqlguL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41kUPvqlguL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['J.R.R. Tolkien']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41kUPvqlguL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="297"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41kUPvqlguL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Fellowship of the Ring: Being the First Part of The Lord of the Rings" height="180"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>9. <em>The Fellowship of the Ring</em> by J.R.R. Tolkien (1968) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007978NPG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007978NPG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-fellowship-of-the-ring-being-the-first-part-of-the-lord-of-the-rings-j-r-r-tolkien" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>
  <span class="dui-icon icon-sm">
    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p><em>The Lord of the Rings</em> has made its mark on high fantasy‚Äôs DNA more than any other work ‚Äî and this is the volume that started it off. Like <em>The Hobbit</em>, its prequel of sorts, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Fellowship-Ring-Being-First-Rings-ebook/dp/B007978NPG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B007978NPG" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Fellowship of the Ring</em></strong></a> is a story that turns on ordinary acts of courage. Running as a counterpoint alongside the thundering motifs of kingly destiny and good-versus-evil, we see the innocent bravery of country gentlemen and the loyalty of gardeners. These, the book argues, are the <em>real</em> engines of historical change. And in today's fantasy landscape overshadowed by the grimdark, returning to Tolkien‚Äôs brand of clear-eyed hope can be a real breath of fresh air.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Watership-Down-Novel-Puffin-Books-ebook/dp/B002NXOQF2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002NXOQF2" data-book-info="{'title':'Watership Down: A Novel (Puffin Books Book 1)','slug':'watership-down-a-novel-puffin-books-book-1-richard-adams','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002NXOQF2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/410BgF0czrL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/410BgF0czrL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Richard Adams']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/410BgF0czrL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="301"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/410BgF0czrL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="Watership Down: A Novel (Puffin Books Book 1)" height="182"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>10. <em>Watership Down</em> by Richard Adams (1972) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002NXOQF2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002NXOQF2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="watership-down-a-novel-puffin-books-book-1-richard-adams" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>
  <span class="dui-icon icon-sm">
    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>If you don‚Äôt think a rabbit warren could be reasonably described as epic fantasy, clearly you‚Äôve never read <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Watership-Down-Novel-Puffin-Books-ebook/dp/B002NXOQF2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002NXOQF2" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Watership Down</em></strong></a>. This stirring adventure story has it all: warriors and visions, harrowing escapes and heartbreaking deaths ‚Äî its stars just happen to be unusually soft of fur and long of ear. Indeed, when human encroachment on their environment threatens their way of life, the rabbits react the way any self-respecting group of noble warriors would: by going on a quest. Despite its adorable premise, Richard Adams‚Äô novel draws on a rich wellspring of literary precedents, and reads like <em>Beowulf</em> by way of Beatrix Potter.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Dark-Rising-Sequence/dp/0689829833?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0689829833" data-book-info="{'title':'The Dark is Rising (The Dark is Rising Sequence)','slug':'the-dark-is-rising-the-dark-is-rising-sequence-susan-cooper','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0689829833?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51+cceyY8cL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51+cceyY8cL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Susan Cooper']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51+cceyY8cL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="295"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51+cceyY8cL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Dark is Rising (The Dark is Rising Sequence)" height="179"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>11. <em>The Dark is Rising</em> by Susan Cooper (1973) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/0689829833?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/0689829833?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-dark-is-rising-the-dark-is-rising-sequence-susan-cooper" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>A perennial favorite of both elementary schoolers <em>and</em> their teachers, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Dark-Rising-Sequence/dp/0689829833?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0689829833" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Dark is Rising</em></strong></a> renders the cosmic conflict between Light and Dark in lively style, at a scale accessible to young readers. It centers on British schoolboy Will Stanton, who discovers, on his eleventh birthday, that he‚Äôs actually an immortal Light warrior known as an Old One ‚Äî bound to play out an eternal struggle against the forces of the Dark. This story is perfectly contextualized by Susan Cooper's vast mythological knowledge, drawing generously from the sea-scented myths of her native British Isles, especially the Arthurian legend.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Princess-Bride-Morgensterns-Classic-Adventure-ebook/dp/B003IEJZRY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B003IEJZRY" data-book-info="{'title':'The Princess Bride: S. Morgenstern's Classic Tale of True Love and High Adventure','slug':'the-princess-bride-s-morgenstern-s-classic-tale-of-true-love-and-high-adventure-william-goldman','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003IEJZRY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yazpJjL8L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yazpJjL8L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['William Goldman']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yazpJjL8L.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="325"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yazpJjL8L._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Princess Bride: S. Morgenstern's Classic Tale of True Love and High Adventure" height="197"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>12. <em>The Princess Bride</em> by William Goldman (1973) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003IEJZRY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003IEJZRY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-princess-bride-s-morgenstern-s-classic-tale-of-true-love-and-high-adventure-william-goldman" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Besides its <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GiMOO1t0tZQ" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>iconic adaptation</strong></a>, Goldman‚Äôs novel is most famous for its delightfully complicated framework: the core story deals with a farm boy called Westley, a gentrywoman named Buttercup, and the many colorful ‚Äî and hilarious ‚Äî obstacles that impede their love. According to <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Princess-Bride-Morgensterns-Classic-Adventure-ebook/dp/B003IEJZRY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B003IEJZRY" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Princess Bride</em></strong></a>'s extensive (fictional) footnotes, this picaresque romance was drawn from Goldman‚Äôs favorite childhood tale, which his father had always read aloud. Years later, when he finally read it for himself, he found out that Goldman Sr. strayed pretty liberally from the text... but the heartwarming adventure story that resulted as all the better for it.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B083G6HS76?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-book-info="{'title':'The Forgotten Beasts of Eld','slug':'the-forgotten-beasts-of-eld-patricia-a-mckillip-27468c07-395c-45ce-9d58-2c77c6676eae','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B083G6HS76?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/514koDXXAbL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/514koDXXAbL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Patricia A. McKillip (1974) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>With its elegant language and a thoughtfully rendered heroine, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Forgotten-Beasts-Eld-Patricia-McKillip-ebook/dp/B06VW2PKQ7?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B06VW2PKQ7" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Forgotten Beasts of Eld</em></strong></a> has won the love of readers young and old (not to mention the 197 World Fantasy Award). The story centers on teenage orphan Sybel, whose only companions are the <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/mythical-creatures" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>sentient, mythical creatures</strong></a> who share her mountain home ‚Äî and with whom she cohabits happily. But one day, a stranger named Coren arrives, along with a newborn he claims to be the rightful heir to the kingdom of Eld. Together, the man and the baby conscript Sybel into single parenthood ‚Äî and drag her quiet mountain refuge into a world of political turmoil.¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Midsummer-Tempest-Poul-Anderson-ebook/dp/B00PI181I4?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00PI181I4" data-book-info="{'title':'A Midsummer Tempest','slug':'a-midsummer-tempest-poul-anderson-c9eeb09f-25f4-43f6-a6e7-9169df729cb1','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00PI181I4?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516ENY-ajOL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516ENY-ajOL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Poul Anderson']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516ENY-ajOL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="301"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516ENY-ajOL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="A Midsummer Tempest" height="182"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>14. <em>A Midsummer Tempest</em> by Poul Anderson (1974) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00PI181I4?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00PI181I4?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="a-midsummer-tempest-poul-anderson-c9eeb09f-25f4-43f6-a6e7-9169df729cb1" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Poul Anderson is better known for his science fiction, but this slim, strange, and utterly engrossing book demonstrates his range as a storyteller. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Midsummer-Tempest-Poul-Anderson-ebook/dp/B00PI181I4?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00PI181I4" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>A Midsummer Tempest</em></strong></a> takes place in an alternate version of 17th century ‚Äî one where everything Shakespeare wrote actually happened and fairies were very much real. Inventive as the premise sounds, this one‚Äôs really quite faithful as far as Shakespearean fanfic goes: all the noble characters speak in iambic pentameter, as if they were written by the Bard himself.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007WKEM9Q?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-book-info="{'title':'Lord Foul's Bane (THE CHRONICLES OF THOMAS COVENANT THE UNBELIEVER Book 1)','slug':'lord-foul-s-bane-the-chronicles-of-thomas-covenant-the-unbeliever-book-1-stephen-r-donaldson-4083fa6d-9d1d-4555-a103-80b12ceea655','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007WKEM9Q?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/518st0KNkTL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/518st0KNkTL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Stephen R. Donaldson']}" contenteditable="false">

Donaldson (1977) </strong></h2></div>

</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>The first installment in the 10-book <em>Chronicles of Thomas Covenant</em>, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Fouls-CHRONICLES-THOMAS-COVENANT-UNBELIEVER-ebook/dp/B007WKEM9Q?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B007WKEM9Q" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Lord Foul‚Äôs Bane</em></strong></a> starts off in a decidedly un-Tolkien-esque fashion: with a protagonist who‚Äôs American, a novelist, and newly recovered from leprosy, a disease to which he lost two fingers. And as far as his new neighbors are concerned, the titular Thomas, with his two missing fingers, is a dead ringer for their culture-hero, Berek Halfhand ‚Äî a misunderstanding that kicks off this complicated and morally grey giant of the genre.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Sword-Shannara-Terry-Brooks-ebook/dp/B000FBFOE6?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FBFOE6" data-book-info="{'title':'The Sword of Shannara','slug':'the-sword-of-shannara-terry-brooks-be178539-5c67-4006-b610-2b9bed47311b','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000FBFOE6?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51G2y0aPxRL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51G2y0aPxRL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Terry Brooks']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51G2y0aPxRL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="327"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51G2y0aPxRL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Sword of Shannara" height="198"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>16. <em>The Sword of Shannara</em> by Terry Brooks (1977) </strong></h2></div>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Terry Brooks‚Äô 1977 fantasy takes place in a post-nuclear-holocaust Pacific Northwest, in which the surviving humans have diverged into five species: Men, Dwarves, Gnomes, Trolls, and Elves. The plot centers on Shea Ohmsford, a half-elven boy destined to wield a legendary sword against a dreaded Warlock Lord. Thanks to this post-apocalyptic premise, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Sword-Shannara-Terry-Brooks-ebook/dp/B000FBFOE6?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FBFOE6" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Sword of Shannara</em></strong></a> interweaves fantasy with science fiction; you might say it depicts fantasy as a result of science fiction, unimaginable violence producing a future that looks like an enchanted vision of the past.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Kindred-Octavia-Butler-ebook/dp/B009U9S540?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B009U9S540" data-book-info="{'title':'Kindred','slug':'kindred-octavia-e-butler-27a7fc06-10f4-4c04-839b-e160a0059fd3','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B009U9S540?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51-NvfFuJsL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51-NvfFuJsL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Octavia E. Butler']}" contenteditable="false">

</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Kindred-Octavia-Butler-ebook/dp/B009U9S540?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B009U9S540" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Kindred</em></strong></a> has been described as a ‚Äúneo-slave narrative using science fiction framework‚Äù ‚Äî a designation that effectively encompasses the thematic complexity of the book. The author herself, however, called <em>Kindred</em> ‚Äúa kind of grim fantasy.‚Äù Indeed, its time-traveling protagonist, a young black woman named Dana, finds herself flickering between 1976 Los Angeles and 1815 Maryland. In the antebellum South, she winds up in the company of her own ancestors ‚Äî an enslaved woman named Alice and a slave-owner named Rufus. Butler‚Äôs spare prose and mastery of psychological detail render the human cost of slavery with devastating clarity.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Neverending-Story-Michael-Ende-ebook/dp/B07FLP3XNP?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07FLP3XNP" data-book-info="{'title':'The Neverending Story','slug':'the-neverending-story-michael-ende-49e89582-1d15-459a-b709-143e3ee2a5a4','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07FLP3XNP?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lk9sIp1YL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lk9sIp1YL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Michael Ende','Ralph Manheim']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>Like fellow multimedia phenomenon <em>The Princess Bride</em>, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Neverending-Story-Michael-Ende-ebook/dp/B07FLP3XNP?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07FLP3XNP" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Neverending Story</em></strong></a> uses a framework narrative to reflect on the power of, well, stories. The title refers to a book within the book: an antique volume unearthed by a boy called Bastian, an outsider at odds with schoolyard bullies and a distant father. As he reads ‚Äî with us peering over his shoulder ‚Äî Bastian is <em>literally</em> pulled into the story of Fantastica, a magical realm ruled by an immortal Childlike Empress. But the empress is dying, and without her power, Fantastica and all its people will disappear. It‚Äôs up to reader-turned-protagonist Bastian to save her.</p></div>
</div><p>
