</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>For anyone ever intrigued by the hush-hush and vaguely felonious undercurrents of Ivy League secret societies, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Ninth-House-Alex-Stern-Book-ebook/dp/B07LF64DZ2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07LF64DZ2" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Ninth House</em></strong></a> is the novel to sate your imagination. It kicks off with 20-year-old Alex Stern, ghost-seer and sole survivor of a brutal homicide, receiving a full-ride scholarship to Yale ‚Äî under the condition that she use her spiritually perceptive powers to monitor the university's eight Houses of the Vale. As part of the titular ninth house, Lethe, Alex must work to uncover the magical abuses of these occult organizations ‚Äî but what she can't know is how dark things will get, and how deeply she's enmeshed in them already.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NCQ6RJG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-book-info="{'title':'Starsight (Skyward Book 2)','slug':'starsight-skyward-book-2-brandon-sanderson','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NCQ6RJG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUy3F+G8L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lUy3F+G8L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Brandon Sanderson']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="true">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Finally we've arrived at <a href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NCQ6RJG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Starsight</em></strong></a><em>, </em>the most recent undertaking by fantasy phenom Brandon Sanderson. In this outer-space spectacular, Sanderson seamlessly picks up the narrative thread of Spensa Nightshade ‚Äî a passionate, psychically gifted young pilot who's become a key weapon in the human war against the alien Krell. Here, Spensa embarks on a dangerous undercover mission to steal a Krell hyperdrive, but what will happen when her true identity is revealed? (Our only advisory before diving headfirst into <em>Starsight </em>is to read the previous installment, <em>Skyward, </em>first ‚Äî especially if you have an <em>Ender's Game</em>-shaped hole in your life.)</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>

>
  <p>

</p><p>Whether you‚Äôve sat around waiting for your Hogwarts letter or looked for Narnia in the back of a closet, you've probably dreamt of stepping into your favorite fantasy books and leaving the real world behind. But the genre isn‚Äôt all witches, wardrobes, and whimsy! Beyond offering temporary escape from the pressures of daily life, the best fantasy books help us confront them.¬†</p><p>
</p><p>Stories of the otherworldly allow readers to make sense of <em>this</em> world, refracting change, wickedness, and heartache through a magical lens so we can see them all more clearly ‚Äî and face them head-on. A good fantasy book illuminates the mind with childlike wonder, but also lingers in our memories because of its connection to real life.</p><p>
</p><p>In other words, great fantasy books show us the world in another guise, yet each is also a universe unto itself. We hope you enjoy exploring them in this list of the best fantasy books of all time!</p><p>
</p><p><strong><em>If you're feeling overwhelmed by the number of amazing fantasy books on hand, you can also take our 30-second quiz below to narrow it down quickly and get a personalized fantasy series recommendation¬†</em></strong>üòâ</p><p><div class="typeform panel">

    <p class="h1 space-bottom-xs">
      üìö
    </p>

<div class="blurb"><p>Even if you‚Äôre not a math geek, you‚Äôre probably familiar with the algebraist Charles Dodgson ‚Äî you just know him his much more famous alter-ego, Lewis Carroll. Unlike Dodgson, Carroll wrote stories that <em>defied</em> logic, twisting it into dreamlike, fantastical shapes: a hookah-smoking caterpillar, a flamingo-filled croquet-ground, a perpetually tardy White Rabbit. The result was <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Alices-Adventures-Wonderland-AmazonClassics-Carroll-ebook/dp/B071RSDB49?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B071RSDB49" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Alice's Adventures in Wonderland</em></strong></a><em>, </em>which has delighted adults and children alike since it was published over a century and a half ago ‚Äî and today is recognized as a momentous early foray into the fantasy genre as a whole.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/King-Elflands-Daughter-Lord-Dunsany-ebook/dp/B01DI5KIDC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01DI5KIDC" data-book-info="{'title':'The King of Elfland's Daughter','slug':'the-king-of-elfland-s-daughter-lord-dunsany-571ac16d-a18f-4019-a35a-de710f307347','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01DI5KIDC?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51k4iQZf8jL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51k4iQZf8jL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Lord Dunsany']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/King-Elflands-Daughter-Lord-Dunsany-ebook/dp/B01DI5KIDC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01DI5KIDC" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The King of Elfland‚Äôs Daughter</em></strong></a> is a fairy tale with deep, dark roots ‚Äî as well as a love story rendered with piercing emotional honesty. It‚Äôs also an unlikely immigration novel, about an elfin princess‚Äôs attempts to deal with her fractured sense of self as she adjusts to the homeland of her beloved human husband.¬†Another remarkably early entry into the fantasy genre, this book prompted Arthur C. Clarke to name Dunsany as one of the greatest writers of his century, and World Fantasy Award winner Jane Yolen to call him ‚Äúthe great grandfather of us all.‚Äù</p></div>
</div><p>

Tolkien']}" contenteditable="false">

Tolkien (1937) </strong></h2></div>

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>It might be a childhood favorite, but <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Hobbit-Lord-Rings-J-R-R-Tolkien-ebook/dp/B0079KT81G?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B0079KT81G" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Hobbit</em></strong></a> gives adult fantasy readers one of the genre‚Äôs most relatable protagonists: a middle-aged homebody who just wants to chill. The iconic Bilbo Baggins speaks to all grownup introverts who like nothing more than a good meal and a cozy chair. But we all hope we‚Äôd find Bilbo-like reservoirs of heroism within us ‚Äî yes, while a career as a Chosen One might be out of reach for us, we can all aspire to be Bilbo Baggins.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>

H. White']}" contenteditable="false">

White (1938) </strong></h2></div>

<div class="blurb"><p>We all know what happens <em>after </em>King Arthur pulls the sword out of the stone; <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Sword-Stone-Essential-Modern-Classics/dp/000726349X?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=000726349X" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Sword in the Stone</em></strong></a> takes a look at the <em>before</em>. Predictably, it‚Äôs much less glamorous. In this telling, the archetypical fantasy monarch was once just a boy called Wart ‚Äî¬†teased by his foster-brother Kay and subjected to a punishing round of lessons that would make any modern high-schooler wince in sympathy. Only Wart‚Äôs education doesn‚Äôt involve AP Calculus and JV Track... and his teacher, Merlyn, prefers to instruct by turning his students into animals instead of grilling them with the Socratic method.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Lion-Witch-Wardrobe-Chronicles-Narnia-ebook/dp/B001I45UFC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B001I45UFC" data-book-info="{'title':'The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe (Chronicles of Narnia Book 2)','slug':'the-lion-the-witch-and-the-wardrobe-chronicles-of-narnia-book-2-c-s-lewis','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B001I45UFC?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51hQ4EstmyL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51hQ4EstmyL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['C.S. <div class="blurb">
<p>When the four Pevensie siblings leave bomb-ravaged London to wait out World War II in the countryside, they discover a portal to the magical land of Narnia behind a pile of fur coats. But their magical new vacation spot suffers from bad leadership: it‚Äôs governed by a witch whose only policy decisions are about ensuring eternal winter with no Christmas cheer. The Pevensies have to oust her ‚Äî with the help of a talking lion! If you‚Äôre a fantasy buff, you‚Äôll already know that the lion is a Christological stand-in, and that <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Lion-Witch-Wardrobe-Chronicles-Narnia-ebook/dp/B001I45UFC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B001I45UFC" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe</em></strong></a> is a meditation on redemption, sacrifice, and faith. But you don‚Äôt need to worship anything to want to drop in on Narnia for an hour or two.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>

</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Master-Margarita-Mikhail-Bulgakov-ebook/dp/B01DV1Y7D0?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01DV1Y7D0" data-book-info="{'title':'The Master and Margarita','slug':'the-master-and-margarita-mikhail-bulgakov-abf670ca-a1bc-4dad-a1d2-be0e73ac6bf6','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01DV1Y7D0?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lLMPTPDDL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lLMPTPDDL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Mikhail Bulgakov','Mirra Ginsburg']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb">
<p>Like the first five books on this list, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Master-Margarita-Mikhail-Bulgakov-ebook/dp/B01DV1Y7D0?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01DV1Y7D0" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Master and Margarita</em></strong></a> is often considered one of the 20th century‚Äôs finest novels. Unlike them, it‚Äôs <em>definitely</em> not for kids. Written at the height of Stalinist repression, it braids together two narrative strands: one a psychologically subtle take on the death of Christ, the other a devilish satire on Soviet intellectual life. And where does the mysterious Muscovian author, known only as the Master, fall in all of this? In reality, fearful of political repression, Mikhail Bulgakov fed his first attempt at this  story to the flames; fortunately for Russophiles and demonologists everywhere, he gave it another try.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>

<div class="blurb">
<p>With its shimmering, lilac-scented prose, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Last-Unicorn-Peter-S-Beagle-ebook/dp/B007EZJKS2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B007EZJKS2" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Last Unicorn</em></strong></a> treads the line between novel and poetry ‚Äî¬†reading with the ease of a bedtime story and the depth of an allegory. In this gossamer world, we meet an immortal Unicorn, who‚Äôs grieved to learn from a hunting party that she might be the last of her kind. Upon leaving her enchanted forest to investigate their claims, she finds that humans perceive her as an ordinary white horse. The Unicorn‚Äôs wanderings put her in the company of ringmasters and harpies, magicians and kings: some who want to harm her, and some who do their best to help.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Wizard-Earthsea-Cycle-Book-ebook/dp/B008T9L6AM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B008T9L6AM" data-book-info="{'title':'A Wizard of Earthsea (The Earthsea Cycle Series Book 1)','slug':'a-wizard-of-earthsea-the-earthsea-cycle-series-book-1-ursula-k-le-guin','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B008T9L6AM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yBOHJFBqL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yBOHJFBqL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Ursula K. Le Guin (1968) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B008T9L6AM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B008T9L6AM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="a-wizard-of-earthsea-the-earthsea-cycle-series-book-1-ursula-k-le-guin" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>On a dense cluster of islands, inhabited by dragons and raised out of the water by a god, master fantasist Ursula K. Le Guin spins out elegant, character-driven tales, enriched by her knowledge of world mythology. Her first installment in the <em>Earthsea </em>series, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Wizard-Earthsea-Cycle-Book-ebook/dp/B008T9L6AM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B008T9L6AM" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>A Wizard of Earthsea</em></strong></a><em>,</em> is a bildungsroman of the old school, albeit enlivened with wizardry: a magical coming-of-age that treats hefty themes like death, the environment, and cosmic balance ‚Äî all with Le Guin‚Äôs characteristically deft touch.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Fellowship-Ring-Being-First-Rings-ebook/dp/B007978NPG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B007978NPG" data-book-info="{'title':'The Fellowship of the Ring: Being the First Part of The Lord of the Rings','slug':'the-fellowship-of-the-ring-being-the-first-part-of-the-lord-of-the-rings-j-r-r-tolkien','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007978NPG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41kUPvqlguL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41kUPvqlguL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['J.R.R. Tolkien']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41kUPvqlguL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="297"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41kUPvqlguL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Fellowship of the Ring: Being the First Part of The Lord of the Rings" height="180"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>9. <em>The Fellowship of the Ring</em> by J.R.R. Tolkien (1968) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007978NPG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007978NPG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-fellowship-of-the-ring-being-the-first-part-of-the-lord-of-the-rings-j-r-r-tolkien" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>
  <span class="dui-icon icon-sm">
    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p><em>The Lord of the Rings</em> has made its mark on high fantasy‚Äôs DNA more than any other work ‚Äî and this is the volume that started it off. Like <em>The Hobbit</em>, its prequel of sorts, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Fellowship-Ring-Being-First-Rings-ebook/dp/B007978NPG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B007978NPG" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Fellowship of the Ring</em></strong></a> is a story that turns on ordinary acts of courage. Running as a counterpoint alongside the thundering motifs of kingly destiny and good-versus-evil, we see the innocent bravery of country gentlemen and the loyalty of gardeners. These, the book argues, are the <em>real</em> engines of historical change. And in today's fantasy landscape overshadowed by the grimdark, returning to Tolkien‚Äôs brand of clear-eyed hope can be a real breath of fresh air.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Watership-Down-Novel-Puffin-Books-ebook/dp/B002NXOQF2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002NXOQF2" data-book-info="{'title':'Watership Down: A Novel (Puffin Books Book 1)','slug':'watership-down-a-novel-puffin-books-book-1-richard-adams','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002NXOQF2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/410BgF0czrL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/410BgF0czrL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Richard Adams']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/410BgF0czrL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="301"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/410BgF0czrL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="Watership Down: A Novel (Puffin Books Book 1)" height="182"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>10. <em>Watership Down</em> by Richard Adams (1972) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002NXOQF2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002NXOQF2?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="watership-down-a-novel-puffin-books-book-1-richard-adams" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>
  <span class="dui-icon icon-sm">
    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>If you don‚Äôt think a rabbit warren could be reasonably described as epic fantasy, clearly you‚Äôve never read <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Watership-Down-Novel-Puffin-Books-ebook/dp/B002NXOQF2?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B002NXOQF2" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Watership Down</em></strong></a>. This stirring adventure story has it all: warriors and visions, harrowing escapes and heartbreaking deaths ‚Äî its stars just happen to be unusually soft of fur and long of ear. Indeed, when human encroachment on their environment threatens their way of life, the rabbits react the way any self-respecting group of noble warriors would: by going on a quest. Despite its adorable premise, Richard Adams‚Äô novel draws on a rich wellspring of literary precedents, and reads like <em>Beowulf</em> by way of Beatrix Potter.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Dark-Rising-Sequence/dp/0689829833?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0689829833" data-book-info="{'title':'The Dark is Rising (The Dark is Rising Sequence)','slug':'the-dark-is-rising-the-dark-is-rising-sequence-susan-cooper','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0689829833?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51+cceyY8cL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51+cceyY8cL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Susan Cooper']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51+cceyY8cL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="295"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51+cceyY8cL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Dark is Rising (The Dark is Rising Sequence)" height="179"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>11. <em>The Dark is Rising</em> by Susan Cooper (1973) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/0689829833?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/0689829833?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-dark-is-rising-the-dark-is-rising-sequence-susan-cooper" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>A perennial favorite of both elementary schoolers <em>and</em> their teachers, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Dark-Rising-Sequence/dp/0689829833?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0689829833" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Dark is Rising</em></strong></a> renders the cosmic conflict between Light and Dark in lively style, at a scale accessible to young readers. It centers on British schoolboy Will Stanton, who discovers, on his eleventh birthday, that he‚Äôs actually an immortal Light warrior known as an Old One ‚Äî bound to play out an eternal struggle against the forces of the Dark. This story is perfectly contextualized by Susan Cooper's vast mythological knowledge, drawing generously from the sea-scented myths of her native British Isles, especially the Arthurian legend.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Princess-Bride-Morgensterns-Classic-Adventure-ebook/dp/B003IEJZRY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B003IEJZRY" data-book-info="{'title':'The Princess Bride: S. Morgenstern's Classic Tale of True Love and High Adventure','slug':'the-princess-bride-s-morgenstern-s-classic-tale-of-true-love-and-high-adventure-william-goldman','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003IEJZRY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yazpJjL8L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yazpJjL8L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['William Goldman']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yazpJjL8L.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="325"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51yazpJjL8L._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Princess Bride: S. Morgenstern's Classic Tale of True Love and High Adventure" height="197"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>12. <em>The Princess Bride</em> by William Goldman (1973) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003IEJZRY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003IEJZRY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-princess-bride-s-morgenstern-s-classic-tale-of-true-love-and-high-adventure-william-goldman" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Besides its <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GiMOO1t0tZQ" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>iconic adaptation</strong></a>, Goldman‚Äôs novel is most famous for its delightfully complicated framework: the core story deals with a farm boy called Westley, a gentrywoman named Buttercup, and the many colorful ‚Äî and hilarious ‚Äî obstacles that impede their love. According to <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Princess-Bride-Morgensterns-Classic-Adventure-ebook/dp/B003IEJZRY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B003IEJZRY" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Princess Bride</em></strong></a>'s extensive (fictional) footnotes, this picaresque romance was drawn from Goldman‚Äôs favorite childhood tale, which his father had always read aloud. Years later, when he finally read it for himself, he found out that Goldman Sr. strayed pretty liberally from the text... but the heartwarming adventure story that resulted as all the better for it.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B083G6HS76?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-book-info="{'title':'The Forgotten Beasts of Eld','slug':'the-forgotten-beasts-of-eld-patricia-a-mckillip-27468c07-395c-45ce-9d58-2c77c6676eae','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B083G6HS76?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/514koDXXAbL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/514koDXXAbL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Patricia A. McKillip (1974) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>With its elegant language and a thoughtfully rendered heroine, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Forgotten-Beasts-Eld-Patricia-McKillip-ebook/dp/B06VW2PKQ7?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B06VW2PKQ7" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Forgotten Beasts of Eld</em></strong></a> has won the love of readers young and old (not to mention the 197 World Fantasy Award). The story centers on teenage orphan Sybel, whose only companions are the <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/mythical-creatures" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>sentient, mythical creatures</strong></a> who share her mountain home ‚Äî and with whom she cohabits happily. But one day, a stranger named Coren arrives, along with a newborn he claims to be the rightful heir to the kingdom of Eld. Together, the man and the baby conscript Sybel into single parenthood ‚Äî and drag her quiet mountain refuge into a world of political turmoil.¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Midsummer-Tempest-Poul-Anderson-ebook/dp/B00PI181I4?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00PI181I4" data-book-info="{'title':'A Midsummer Tempest','slug':'a-midsummer-tempest-poul-anderson-c9eeb09f-25f4-43f6-a6e7-9169df729cb1','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00PI181I4?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516ENY-ajOL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516ENY-ajOL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Poul Anderson']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516ENY-ajOL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="301"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516ENY-ajOL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="A Midsummer Tempest" height="182"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>14. <em>A Midsummer Tempest</em> by Poul Anderson (1974) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00PI181I4?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00PI181I4?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="a-midsummer-tempest-poul-anderson-c9eeb09f-25f4-43f6-a6e7-9169df729cb1" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Poul Anderson is better known for his science fiction, but this slim, strange, and utterly engrossing book demonstrates his range as a storyteller. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Midsummer-Tempest-Poul-Anderson-ebook/dp/B00PI181I4?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00PI181I4" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>A Midsummer Tempest</em></strong></a> takes place in an alternate version of 17th century ‚Äî one where everything Shakespeare wrote actually happened and fairies were very much real. Inventive as the premise sounds, this one‚Äôs really quite faithful as far as Shakespearean fanfic goes: all the noble characters speak in iambic pentameter, as if they were written by the Bard himself.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007WKEM9Q?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-book-info="{'title':'Lord Foul's Bane (THE CHRONICLES OF THOMAS COVENANT THE UNBELIEVER Book 1)','slug':'lord-foul-s-bane-the-chronicles-of-thomas-covenant-the-unbeliever-book-1-stephen-r-donaldson-4083fa6d-9d1d-4555-a103-80b12ceea655','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007WKEM9Q?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/518st0KNkTL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/518st0KNkTL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Stephen R. Donaldson']}" contenteditable="false">

Donaldson (1977) </strong></h2></div>

</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>The first installment in the 10-book <em>Chronicles of Thomas Covenant</em>, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Fouls-CHRONICLES-THOMAS-COVENANT-UNBELIEVER-ebook/dp/B007WKEM9Q?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B007WKEM9Q" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Lord Foul‚Äôs Bane</em></strong></a> starts off in a decidedly un-Tolkien-esque fashion: with a protagonist who‚Äôs American, a novelist, and newly recovered from leprosy, a disease to which he lost two fingers. And as far as his new neighbors are concerned, the titular Thomas, with his two missing fingers, is a dead ringer for their culture-hero, Berek Halfhand ‚Äî a misunderstanding that kicks off this complicated and morally grey giant of the genre.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Sword-Shannara-Terry-Brooks-ebook/dp/B000FBFOE6?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FBFOE6" data-book-info="{'title':'The Sword of Shannara','slug':'the-sword-of-shannara-terry-brooks-be178539-5c67-4006-b610-2b9bed47311b','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000FBFOE6?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51G2y0aPxRL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51G2y0aPxRL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Terry Brooks']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51G2y0aPxRL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="327"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51G2y0aPxRL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Sword of Shannara" height="198"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>16. <em>The Sword of Shannara</em> by Terry Brooks (1977) </strong></h2></div>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Terry Brooks‚Äô 1977 fantasy takes place in a post-nuclear-holocaust Pacific Northwest, in which the surviving humans have diverged into five species: Men, Dwarves, Gnomes, Trolls, and Elves. The plot centers on Shea Ohmsford, a half-elven boy destined to wield a legendary sword against a dreaded Warlock Lord. Thanks to this post-apocalyptic premise, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Sword-Shannara-Terry-Brooks-ebook/dp/B000FBFOE6?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FBFOE6" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Sword of Shannara</em></strong></a> interweaves fantasy with science fiction; you might say it depicts fantasy as a result of science fiction, unimaginable violence producing a future that looks like an enchanted vision of the past.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Kindred-Octavia-Butler-ebook/dp/B009U9S540?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B009U9S540" data-book-info="{'title':'Kindred','slug':'kindred-octavia-e-butler-27a7fc06-10f4-4c04-839b-e160a0059fd3','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B009U9S540?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51-NvfFuJsL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51-NvfFuJsL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Octavia E. Butler']}" contenteditable="false">

</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Kindred-Octavia-Butler-ebook/dp/B009U9S540?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B009U9S540" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Kindred</em></strong></a> has been described as a ‚Äúneo-slave narrative using science fiction framework‚Äù ‚Äî a designation that effectively encompasses the thematic complexity of the book. The author herself, however, called <em>Kindred</em> ‚Äúa kind of grim fantasy.‚Äù Indeed, its time-traveling protagonist, a young black woman named Dana, finds herself flickering between 1976 Los Angeles and 1815 Maryland. In the antebellum South, she winds up in the company of her own ancestors ‚Äî an enslaved woman named Alice and a slave-owner named Rufus. Butler‚Äôs spare prose and mastery of psychological detail render the human cost of slavery with devastating clarity.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Neverending-Story-Michael-Ende-ebook/dp/B07FLP3XNP?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07FLP3XNP" data-book-info="{'title':'The Neverending Story','slug':'the-neverending-story-michael-ende-49e89582-1d15-459a-b709-143e3ee2a5a4','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07FLP3XNP?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lk9sIp1YL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51lk9sIp1YL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Michael Ende','Ralph Manheim']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>Like fellow multimedia phenomenon <em>The Princess Bride</em>, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Neverending-Story-Michael-Ende-ebook/dp/B07FLP3XNP?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07FLP3XNP" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Neverending Story</em></strong></a> uses a framework narrative to reflect on the power of, well, stories. The title refers to a book within the book: an antique volume unearthed by a boy called Bastian, an outsider at odds with schoolyard bullies and a distant father. As he reads ‚Äî with us peering over his shoulder ‚Äî Bastian is <em>literally</em> pulled into the story of Fantastica, a magical realm ruled by an immortal Childlike Empress. But the empress is dying, and without her power, Fantastica and all its people will disappear. It‚Äôs up to reader-turned-protagonist Bastian to save her.</p></div>
</div><p>

</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Little-Big-John-Crowley-ebook/dp/B005DB7O0U?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B005DB7O0U" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Little, Big</em></strong></a> is the perfect fantasy novel for people who don‚Äôt like fantasy. It reads like a prestigious generational saga, the kind of thing you‚Äôd find in English dissertations and on Booker Prize shortlists ‚Äî just with a few fairies thrown into the mix. No wonder literary critic Harold Bloom, notorious for thumbing his nose at the likes of <em>Harry Potter</em>, praised it as a ‚Äúneglected masterpiece.‚Äù At its center is the Drinkwater family, whose architect patriarch built their sprawling family estate in the hazy borderlands between the Faerie world and New York ‚Äî which invites a great deal of complexity into their lives.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Dark-Tower-I-Gunslinger-ebook/dp/B018ER7JRC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B018ER7JRC" data-book-info="{'title':'The Dark Tower I: The Gunslinger','slug':'the-dark-tower-i-the-gunslinger-stephen-king','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B018ER7JRC?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51HDlI3s9eL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51HDlI3s9eL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Stephen King']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51HDlI3s9eL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="299"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51HDlI3s9eL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="The Dark Tower I: The Gunslinger" height="181"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>20. <em>The Gunslinger</em> by Stephen King (1982) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B018ER7JRC?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B018ER7JRC?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-dark-tower-i-the-gunslinger-stephen-king" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Stephen King is best known for <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/best-stephen-king-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>infiltrating our nightmares</strong></a> with stalkers and murderous clowns. But <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Dark-Tower-I-Gunslinger-ebook/dp/B018ER7JRC?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B018ER7JRC" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Gunslinger</em></strong></a> proves he‚Äôs got a gift for fantasy too ‚Äî just don‚Äôt expect it to be light and fluffy! This novel pulls from a broad palette of influences, from cowboy westerns to the poetry of Robert Browning. The hero, Roland of Gilead, wields his gun in pursuit of a shadowy Man in Black who's as dangerous as he is mysterious, with the power to spawn demons and raise the dead. Luckily or not, Roland's not alone in his pursuit; he finds a traveling companion in Jake Chambers, a schoolboy from our world.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Color-Magic-Novel-Discworld-ebook/dp/B000W9399S?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000W9399S" data-book-info="{'title':'The Color of Magic: A Novel of Discworld','slug':'the-color-of-magic-a-novel-of-discworld-terry-pratchett','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000W9399S?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Vh3wGCBVL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51Vh3wGCBVL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Terry Pratchett']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>Beloved fantasy writer Terry Pratchett made his name on tales from Discworld: a flat, circular planet, carried on the backs of four elephants balanced on a turtle. The 41-book series is a world unto its own ‚Äî and it all began with <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Color-Magic-Novel-Discworld-ebook/dp/B000W9399S?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000W9399S" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Color of Magic</em></strong></a>. Pratchett conceived the book as an antidote to the dark lord-y, paint-by-numbers fantasy that saturated the market at the time. The result is playful-yet-thoughtful story about an incompetent wizard and a ignorant tourist, whose adventure reads like a hilarious, sparkling travelogue.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Mists-Avalon-Marion-Zimmer-Bradley-ebook/dp/B000FC1JCQ?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FC1JCQ" data-book-info="{'title':'The Mists of Avalon: A Novel','slug':'the-mists-of-avalon-a-novel-marion-zimmer-bradley','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000FC1JCQ?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41II-qq8gpL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41II-qq8gpL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Marion Zimmer Bradley']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>The most influential reimagining of the Arthurian legend since <em>The Sword and the Stone</em>, this sharply observed novel turns a feminist gaze on age-old tales. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Mists-Avalon-Marion-Zimmer-Bradley-ebook/dp/B000FC1JCQ?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FC1JCQ" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Mists of Avalon</em></strong></a> centers on Arthur‚Äôs sorcerous half-sister Morgaine ‚Äî better known as Morgan le Fay. A pagan priestess of Avalon blessed with clairvoyance, she‚Äôs troubled by the encroachment of Christian missionaries into the land she loves. Her sister-in-law Gwenhwyfar, meanwhile, emerges as her opposite: a devout and increasingly fanatical Christian. The ideological clash between them represents a far greater conflict, which the book unflinchingly depicts with all the dark tragedy of the original legend.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Bridge-Birds-Ancient-Chronicles-Master/dp/0345321383?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0345321383" data-book-info="{'title':'Bridge of Birds','slug':'bridge-of-birds-barry-hughart','synopsis':'When the children of his village were struck with a mysterious illness, Number Ten Ox sought a wiseman to save them. He found master Li Kao, a scholar with a slight flaw in his character. Together, they set out to find the Great Root of Power, the only possible cure.<br /><br />The quest led them to a host of truly memorable characters, multiple wonders, incredible adventures‚Äîand strange coincidences, which were really not coincidences at all. And it involved them in an ancient crime that still perturbed the serenity of Heaven. Simply and charmingly told, this is a wry tale, a sly tale, and a story of wisdom delightfully askew. Once read, its marvels and beauty will not easily fade from the mind.<br /><br />The author claims that this is a novel of an ancient China that never was. But, oh‚Ä¶it should have been!','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0345321383?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1327940289l/15177._SY160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Barry Hughart']}" contenteditable="false" draggable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>
In an era when ‚Äúfantasy‚Äù was synonymous with ‚Äúfake medieval Europe,‚Äù <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Bridge-Birds-Ancient-Chronicles-Master/dp/0345321383?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0345321383" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Bridge of Birds</em></strong></a> gave us something wonderfully original: a novel set ‚Äî as its subtitle explains ‚Äî in ‚Äúan ancient China that never was.‚Äù We see this reimagining through the eyes of Number Ten Ox, a young man those village is ravaged by a mysterious plague that destroys silkworms and renders its children unconscious. He finds aid in Master Li Kao, a scholar with a drinking problem ‚Äî and an encyclopedic knowledge of poisons. Together, Number Ten Ox and Master Li set off in search for a cure... only to be drawn into the heady world of imperial politics.</p><p>
</p><p><br></p><p>
</p></div>

</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Mythago-Wood-Cycle-Robert-Holdstock/dp/0765307294?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765307294" data-book-info="{'title':'Mythago Wood','slug':'mythago-wood-robert-holdstock','synopsis':'The mystery of Ryhope Wood, Britain's last fragment of primeval forest, consumed George Huxley's entire, and long, life. Now, after his death, his sons have taken up his work. But what they discover is beyond what they could have expected. For the Wood is a realm where myths gain flesh and blood, tapping primal fears and desires subdued through the millennia. A realm where love and beauty haunt your dreams -- and may drive you insane. <br /><br />Mythago Wood won the World Fantasy Award on its first publication in 1984, and secured Robert Holdstock's reputation as one of the major fantasy writers of our time. <div class="blurb"><p>Celebrated for its dazzling prose, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Mythago-Wood-Cycle-Robert-Holdstock/dp/0765307294?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0765307294" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Mythago Wood</em></strong></a> is as densely enchanting as the English forest at its center: the ancient, otherworldly Ryhope Wood. Make your way between the old-growth trees and you'll discover its inhabitants ‚Äî myth-images, or mythagos, who have come out of ancestral memory and the story-seeped subconscious of the human mind. These might be monsters, centaurs, or several different versions of King Arthur. We explore Ryhope Wood with the Huxley brothers: World War II veteran Stephen regards the forest‚Äôs mysteries with measured skepticism, even as his brother Christian starts to lose himself within it.¬†¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Howls-Moving-Castle-Book-ebook/dp/B008LV8TSU?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B008LV8TSU" data-book-info="{'title':'Howl's Moving Castle (Howl's Castle Book 1)','slug':'howl-s-moving-castle-howl-s-castle-book-1-diana-wynne-jones','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B008LV8TSU?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51ISwYcrAxL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51ISwYcrAxL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Diana Wynne Jones']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

<div class="blurb"><p>Gorgeously brought to life by the Studio Ghibli anime of the same name, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Howls-Moving-Castle-Book-ebook/dp/B008LV8TSU?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B008LV8TSU" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Howl‚Äôs Moving Castle</em></strong></a> combines whimsy and poignancy in the tradition of the <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/best-childrens-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>best children‚Äôs fiction</strong></a> ‚Äî and doesn't skimp on the allusions, moving breezily from Shakespeare to Lewis Carroll. The story begins with 18-year-old Sophie Hatter, who seems condemned to a lifetime of drudgery at the family hat shop. But when she‚Äôs aged several decades by a witch‚Äôs curse, a suddenly geriatric Sophie finds her way to a moving castle ruled by the eccentric wizard Howl, whose fire-demon servant holds the key to restoring her youth.¬†</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Good-Omens-Accurate-Prophecies-Nutter/dp/0060853972?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0060853972" data-book-info="{'title':'Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch','slug':'good-omens-the-nice-and-accurate-prophecies-of-agnes-nutter-witch-terry-pratchett','synopsis':'‚ÄòArmageddon only happens once, you know. They don‚Äôt let you go around again until you get it right.‚Äô<br /><br />People have been predicting the end of the world almost from its very beginning, so it‚Äôs only natural to be sceptical when a new date is set for Judgement Day. But what if, for once, the predictions are right, and the apocalypse really is due to arrive next Saturday, just after tea?<br /><br />You could spend the time left drowning your sorrows, giving away all your possessions in preparation for the rapture, or laughing it off as (hopefully) just another hoax. Or you could just try to do something about it.<br /><br />It‚Äôs a predicament that Aziraphale, a somewhat fussy angel, and Crowley, a fast-living demon now finds themselves in. They‚Äôve been living amongst Earth‚Äôs mortals since The Beginning and, truth be told, have grown rather fond of the lifestyle and, in all honesty, are not actually looking forward to the coming Apocalypse.<br /><br />And then there‚Äôs the small matter that someone appears to have misplaced the Antichrist‚Ä¶','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0060853972?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1450459140l/12070.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Terry Pratchett']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1450459140l/12070.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="149"><img data-srcset="undefined" draggable="false" width="120" alt="Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch" height="90"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>26. <em>Good Omens</em> by Neil Gaiman and Terry Pratchett (1990) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>The end of the world has never been so funny. Equal parts biting and heartwarming, this charmingly English take on the Apocalypse combines the talents of golden-age Terry Pratchett and a young Neil Gaiman just discovering his novelistic voice. Take this dream team, add 50% more laughter than you think is possible, and you‚Äôll have <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Good-Omens-Accurate-Prophecies-Nutter/dp/0060853972?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0060853972" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Good Omens</em></strong></a>. The book‚Äôs tween Anti-Christ, Adam, is refreshingly human and irresistibly likable. But its true stars are the fussy angel Aziraphale and sauntering demon Crowley, who steal the show with their unlikely bond ‚Äî and their rogue efforts to put a pin in Armageddon.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Famished-Road-Novel-Ben-Okri-ebook/dp/B01KYUOAZG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01KYUOAZG" data-book-info="{'title':'The Famished Road: A Novel (The Famished Road Trilogy Book 1)','slug':'the-famished-road-a-novel-the-famished-road-trilogy-book-1-ben-okri','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01KYUOAZG?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/514t7+BlU+L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/514t7+BlU+L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Ben Okri']}" contenteditable="false">

</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>Booker Prize winner <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Famished-Road-Novel-Ben-Okri-ebook/dp/B01KYUOAZG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B01KYUOAZG" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Famished Road</em></strong></a> makes an eloquent case for the place of magical creatures in the literary big leagues ‚Äî and, in 1991, brought fantasy out of its traditional Anglo-American silo. Author Ben Okri moves fluidly between genres and influences: combining Yoruba oral traditions and Shakespearean allusions, mixing <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/magical-realism" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>magical realism</strong></a> with Enlightenment philosophy. His very protagonist, Azaro, is a creature of the hybrid and the in-between: an <em>abiku</em>, or child spirit, he dwells between the realms of the living and the dead. But Okri manages to ground this unorthodox story with spare, elegant prose and devastating pathos.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Was-novel-Geoff-Ryman-ebook/dp/B00BAZV4FY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00BAZV4FY" data-book-info="{'title':'Was: a novel','slug':'was-a-novel-geoff-ryman','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BAZV4FY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41lOZ-uPxUL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/41lOZ-uPxUL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Geoff Ryman']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BAZV4FY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BAZV4FY?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="was-a-novel-geoff-ryman" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This wildly inventive novel snagged a nomination for the World Fantasy Prize, but it‚Äôs about as far from sword and sorcery as you can get. A gritty remix of <em>The Wonderful Wizard of Oz</em>, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Was-novel-Geoff-Ryman-ebook/dp/B00BAZV4FY?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00BAZV4FY" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Was</em></strong></a> uses L. Frank Baum‚Äôs sunny fable to examine the mundane tragedies of modern life, from child abuse to HIV. The main character of this tale is an orphan named Dorothy Gael, whose Uncle Henry abuses her with Aunty Em‚Äôs tacit consent. Her story runs alongside another one equally tragic ‚Äî that of a gay actor weakened by AIDS. Close to dying, he rallies for a final pilgrimage to Kansas, drawn by memories of his childhood fascination with Oz.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Interview-Vampire-Chronicles-Book-ebook/dp/B004AM5R20?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B004AM5R20" data-book-info="{'title':'Interview with the Vampire (The Vampire Chronicles, Book 1)','slug':'interview-with-the-vampire-the-vampire-chronicles-book-1-anne-rice','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B004AM5R20?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51U5LSYpe6L.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51U5LSYpe6L._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Anne Rice']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb">
<p>Haunting, sexy, and grim, Anne Rice‚Äôs gothic novel paved the way for Twilightmania ‚Äî just don‚Äôt expect her vampires to sparkle. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Interview-Vampire-Chronicles-Book-ebook/dp/B004AM5R20?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B004AM5R20" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Interview with the Vampire</em></strong></a> centers on 200-year-old, world-weary Louis, who finds himself telling his life story to a cub reporter. As we listen in on their interview, we meet the colorful characters who shaped Louis‚Äô long afterlife: his cruelly charismatic lover Lestat ‚Äî the vampire who turned him ‚Äî and their tragic ‚Äúdaughter‚Äù Claudia, whose eternally childish form can‚Äôt contain her sharp wit and grown-up rage.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>

</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Towing-Jehovah-Harvest-James-Morrow-ebook/dp/B00IWTRB3A?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00IWTRB3A" data-book-info="{'title':'Towing Jehovah (Harvest Book)','slug':'towing-jehovah-harvest-book-james-morrow','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00IWTRB3A?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51RAT9SaZXL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51RAT9SaZXL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['James Morrow']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

    <svg viewBox="0 0 16 16">
      <g stroke="none" stroke-width="1" fill="none" fill-rule="evenodd">
        <path id="icon-fill" d="M9.33333333,9.33333333 L9.33333333,14.680572 C9.33333333,15.4092719 8.74260528,16 8.01390529,16 L7.98609471,16 C7.25739472,16 6.66666667,15.4092719 6.66666667,14.680572 L6.66666667,9.33333333 L1.31942805,9.33333333 C0.590728057,9.33333333 0,8.74260528 0,8.01390529 L0,7.98609471 C0,7.25739472 0.590728057,6.66666667 1.31942805,6.66666667 L6.66666667,6.66666667 L6.66666667,1.31942805 C6.66666667,0.590728057 7.25739472,0 7.98609471,0 L8.01390529,0 C8.74260528,0 9.33333333,0.590728057 9.33333333,1.31942805 L9.33333333,6.66666667 L14.680572,6.66666667 C15.4092719,6.66666667 16,7.25739472 16,7.98609471 L16,8.01390529 C16,8.74260528 15.4092719,9.33333333 14.680572,9.33333333 L9.33333333,9.33333333 Z" fill="#FFFFFF"></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This oddball religious satire spins the famous Nietzsche quote into a fantastic story: God is dead, and now there‚Äôs another corpse in the Atlantic, looking like any old white guy ‚Äî except two miles long. As a result, oil tanker captain Anthony Van Horne finds himself with an unexpected new gig, courtesy of the archangel Raphael. The heavenly hosts expect him to, well, <em>tow Jehovah</em>: transport His corpse to the Arctic to be embalmed by its icy waters. Morrow‚Äôs effervescent cleverness has drawn endless comparisons to <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/kurt-vonnegut-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>Kurt Vonnegut</strong></a>, but <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Towing-Jehovah-Harvest-James-Morrow-ebook/dp/B00IWTRB3A?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B00IWTRB3A" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Towing Jehovah</em></strong></a>‚Äôs theological snark evokes <em>Good Omens</em>, too.¬†</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Assassins-Apprentice-Farseer-Trilogy-Book-ebook/dp/B000FBFMG6?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FBFMG6" data-book-info="{'title':'Assassin's Apprentice (The Farseer Trilogy, Book 1)','slug':'assassin-s-apprentice-the-farseer-trilogy-book-1-robin-hobb','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000FBFMG6?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51BLMpvx6BL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51BLMpvx6BL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Robin Hobb','Michael Whelan','John Howe']}" contenteditable="false">

</div>
<div class="blurb"><p>A stunning example of high, epic fantasy played straight, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Assassins-Apprentice-Farseer-Trilogy-Book-ebook/dp/B000FBFMG6?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FBFMG6" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Assassin‚Äôs Apprentice</em></strong></a> introduces us to the bravest bastard this side of Jon Snow. The illegitimate son of a prince named Chivalry, the boy called Fitz grows up a loner. If he wants company, he prefers to draw on the Wit ‚Äî his telepathic link to animals ‚Äî instead of talking to another human. But when his powerful relations finally summon him to court, Fitz is forced to change his wild ways ‚Äî and soon begins training as an assassin and kingsman to the new ruler, Shrewd (another symbolic name).</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/His-Dark-Materials-Golden-Compass-ebook/dp/B000FC1ICM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FC1ICM" data-book-info="{'title':'His Dark Materials: The Golden Compass (Book 1)','slug':'his-dark-materials-the-golden-compass-book-1-philip-pullman','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000FC1ICM?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516YLKoyukL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516YLKoyukL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Philip Pullman']}" contenteditable="false">
<picture><source data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516YLKoyukL.jpg" width="198" media="(min-width: 480px)" height="297"><img data-srcset="https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/516YLKoyukL._SL160_.jpg" draggable="false" width="120" alt="His Dark Materials: The Golden Compass (Book 1)" height="180"></picture><div class="title"><h2><strong>32. <em>The Golden Compass</em> by Philip Pullman (1995) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">

</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p>This stunning YA fantasy opens the <em>His Dark Materials</em> trilogy, which can only be described as the anti-Narnia: a literary monument to secular humanism. This first installment centers on Lyra Belacqua, an orphan raised by a committee of graybeards at Oxford. <a href="https://blog.reedsy.com/worldbuilding-guide/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>Her fantastical world is crafted</strong></a> by Pullman with all the deft-fingered care of a Renaissance painter, laying on the details stroke by stroke. Perhaps most excitingly, here there be daemons: externalized souls that tail each person in animal form. Lyra‚Äôs daemon, Pantalaimon, is one of the book‚Äôs most lovable (and important) characters ‚Äî and after reading <a href="https://www.amazon.com/His-Dark-Materials-Golden-Compass-ebook/dp/B000FC1ICM?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000FC1ICM" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Golden Compass</em></strong></a><em>,</em> you‚Äôll definitely want your own.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Game-Thrones-Song-Fire-Book-ebook/dp/B000QCS8TW?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000QCS8TW" data-book-info="{'title':'A Game of Thrones (A Song of Ice and Fire, Book 1)','slug':'a-game-of-thrones-a-song-of-ice-and-fire-book-1-george-r-r-martin-d6c0f63f-2a6f-4400-8cbf-6dba78ef8fa8','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000QCS8TW?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51D+-f5UcDL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51D+-f5UcDL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['George R. R. Martin']}" contenteditable="false">

Martin (1996) </strong></h2></div>

<div class="blurb">
<p>While we wait for G.R.R. Martin to finish up his long-running series‚Äô sixth installment, it‚Äôs worth revisiting the book that made his name ‚Äî and gave<em> its </em>name to the show that brought TV fantasy into the mainstream. If <em>His Dark Materials</em> is the anti-Narnia, then <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Game-Thrones-Song-Fire-Book-ebook/dp/B000QCS8TW?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B000QCS8TW" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>A Game of Thrones</em></strong></a> and its sequels are the anti-LOTR. In a sharp-toothed reaction to Tolkien‚Äôs idealism, Martin gives us a quasi-medieval setting as rich in magic as Middle-earth, though it runs on cynical realpolitik instead of quiet courage. <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/grimdark-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>In this grimdark world</strong></a>, winter is coming, debts must be paid, and noble characters can die ugly, senseless deaths at any time.</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>

<div class="blurb">
<p>If you need a summary of <em>this </em>book, you‚Äôve been living under a rock for the past few decades. Love them or hate them, <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/harry-potter-books-in-order" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>the <em>Harry Potter</em> series</strong></a> has shaped millennials more than any other media phenomena, creating a generation of bookworms inclined to question authority. The Boy Who Lived is now approaching middle-age ‚Äî canonically born in 1980, he's just about 40 now. But as the book that kickstarted his literary career, <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Harry-Potter-Sorcerers-Stone-Rowling-ebook/dp/B0192CTMYG?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B0192CTMYG" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</em></strong></a> remains as influential as ever, with Hogwarts houses being as legitimate a source of identity as zodiac signs.¬†¬†</p>

</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/1433254921?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-book-info="{'title':'The Moon and the Sun','slug':'the-moon-and-the-sun-mcintyre','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/1433254921?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/61IVb30q0rL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/61IVb30q0rL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['McIntyre','Vonda N.','Fields','Anna (Narrator)']}" contenteditable="false">

McIntyre (1997) </strong></h2></div>
<div class="grid-flex grid-shrink grid-no-response buttons-wrapper">
<a class="button button-sm button-yellow buy-button space-right-2em" href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/1433254921?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Buy on Amazon</a><div class="add-to-library-wrapper hidden"><button data-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/1433254921?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" data-slug="the-moon-and-the-sun-mcintyre" class="button button-sm button-white-bordered add-to-library-button"><span class="valign-middle space-right-1em">Add to library</span>

      </g>
    </svg>
  </span>
</button></div>
</div>
<div class="blurb">
<p><em>A Game of Thrones </em>might be the more famous book today, but <a href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/1433254921?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>The Moon and the Sun</em></strong></a> narrowly beat it out to win the prestigious Nebula Award for Best Novel in 1998! An intricate historical romance made magical through the addition of mermaids and immortality quests, <em>The Moon and the Sun</em> takes place in the palace of the Sun King, who ruled over late 17th-century France. We encounter his dazzling world through the eyes of Marie-Jos√®phe de la Croix, a lady-in-waiting who is the only person at court able to see Versailles‚Äô new mermaid resident as a person instead of a monster (with delicious shades of <em>The Shape of Water</em>).</p>
<p><br></p>
</div>
</div><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/Perdido-Street-Station-Bas-Lag-Mi%C3%A9ville/dp/0345443020?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0345443020" data-book-info="{'title':'Perdido Street Station (Bas-Lag)','slug':'perdido-street-station-bas-lag-china-mieville','synopsis':'','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0345443020?tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1','covers':{'large':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51BxiDHHdmL.jpg','small':'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51BxiDHHdmL._SL160_.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['China Mi√©ville']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb"><p>China Mi√©ville has defined his own work as ‚Äúa breathless and genre-slippery macabre fiction‚Äù ‚Äî and with its heady mixture of <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/steampunk-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>Victorian tech</strong></a>, black magic, and organized crime, this book is par for the course. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Perdido-Street-Station-Bas-Lag-Mi%C3%A9ville/dp/0345443020?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0345443020" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>Perdido Street Station</em></strong></a> takes place in the steampunk city of New Crobuzon, where humans rub shoulders with other strange and intelligent species. But this peaceful coexistence is jeopardized when a hallucinogenic experiment unleashes the slakemoth: a mind-eating monster with paralytic in its wings. As they attempt to save the city, protagonist Isaac and his friends soon find themselves pulled into the seedy underbelly of New Crobuzon politics, discovering more than they ever wanted to know about their bizarre home.</p></div>
</div><p>
</p><h2> </h2><p>
</p><p> </p><p>
</p><div class="book-blot" data-url="https://www.amazon.com/American-Gods-Novel-Neil-Gaiman/dp/0062572237?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0062572237" data-book-info="{'title':'American Gods','slug':'american-gods-neil-gaiman-e3b76a5b-773b-4b6c-9327-5900e93a2be0','synopsis':'Locked behind bars for three years, Shadow did his time, quietly waiting for the day when he could return to Eagle Point, Indiana. A man no longer scared of what tomorrow might bring, all he wanted was to be with Laura, the wife he deeply loved, and start a new life.<br /><br />But just days before his release, Laura and Shadow‚Äôs best friend are killed in an accident. With his life in pieces and nothing to keep him tethered, Shadow accepts a job from a beguiling stranger he meets on the way home, an enigmatic man who calls himself Mr. Wednesday. A trickster and a rogue, Wednesday seems to know more about Shadow than Shadow does himself.<br /><br />Life as Wednesday‚Äôs bodyguard, driver, and errand boy is far more interesting and dangerous than Shadow ever imagined. Soon Shadow learns that the past never dies . . . and that beneath the placid surface of everyday life a storm is brewing‚Äîan epic war for the very soul of America‚Äîand that he is standing squarely in its path. <br /><br /><i>This is the author's preferred text, never before published in the UK, and is about 12,000 words longer than the previous UK edition.</i><br /><br />','url':'https://www.amazon.com/dp/0062572237?tag=reedwebs-20','covers':{'large':'https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1487944398l/30531880.jpg'},'provider':'amazon','authors':['Neil Gaiman']}" contenteditable="false">

<div class="blurb">
<p>A decade after <em>Good Omens</em>, Neil Gaiman returned to the world of religious fantasy with this magnificent solo venture. <a href="https://www.amazon.com/American-Gods-Novel-Neil-Gaiman/dp/0062572237?SubscriptionId=AKIAJJIX76K7CKA7Q6TA&tag=reedwebs-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=0062572237" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong><em>American Gods</em></strong></a> blends old legends with a <a href="https://reedsy.com/discovery/blog/urban-fantasy-books" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>modern noir sensibility</strong></a> ‚Äî it‚Äôs peopled with deities and convicts, and the distinctions between them aren‚Äôt always clear. At its center is the improbably named Shadow Moon, a new widower who drifts into the employ of a con-man named Mr. Wednesday. They go on a good, old-fashioned American road-trip ‚Äî but Shadow soon discovers that their cross-country trek isn‚Äôt all that it appears to be</p>
